    FCC filing suggests Samsung Galaxy Watch 5 will get fast charging
    The Galaxy Watch 5 lineup can‚Äôt afford to have lackluster battery life without fast charging. | Photo by Dieter Bohn / The Verge While we still don‚Äôt know all the nitty-gritty details about Samsung‚Äôs next-gen smartwatches, recent FCC filings hint that you can expect at least one big update: faster charging. FCC filings don‚Äôt reveal too much in terms of features, but they are a good indicator that a product is getting close to launch. The filings were first spotted by 9to5Google and indicate there‚Äôll be three models dubbed the SM-R900, the SM-R910, and the SM-R920. They also confirm basic connectivity specs, like the fact that the watches will support Bluetooth, 2.4 and 5Ghz Wi-Fi, and contactless payments. But as far as the Samsung Galaxy Watch 5 lineup goes, the most eye-catching thing is that the watches can charge at 10W speeds. For context, the Galaxy Watch 4... Continue reading‚Ä¶  ( 3 min )
    Google suspends engineer who claims its AI is sentient
    Its LaMDA system is built to make AI more conversational. | Photo by Amelia Holowaty Krales / The Verge Google has placed one of its engineers on paid administrative leave for allegedly breaking its confidentiality policies after he grew concerned that an AI chatbot system had achieved sentience, the Washington Post reports. The engineer, Blake Lemoine, works for Google‚Äôs Responsible AI organization, and was testing whether its LaMDA model generates discriminatory language or hate speech. The engineer‚Äôs concerns reportedly grew out of convincing responses he saw the AI system generating about its rights and the ethics of robotics. In April he shared a document with executives titled ‚ÄúIs LaMDA Sentient?‚Äù containing a transcript of his conversations with the AI (after being placed on leave, Lemoine published the transcript via his Medium... Continue reading‚Ä¶  ( 3 min )
    DeFi lending giant Celsius halts withdrawals
    Exhibition And Experience Zones at The Paris NFT Day Conference The Celsius Network, a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform and one of the largest crypto lenders, announced Sunday night that it was ‚Äúpausing all withdrawals, Swap, and transfers between accounts.‚Äù It has 1.7 million customers. The company‚Äôs token, CEL, is trading at 23 cents as of this writing, according to CoinMarketCap. That‚Äôs a 92 percent decrease from April 8th, when CEL was worth $3. The token was worth nearly $7 a year ago. There have been questions about Celsius Networks‚Äô high yields, its connections to failed stablecoin Terra, and its reserves. The value of assets on its platform dropped by half to $12 billion in May, from $24 billion in December 2021. Between March and May, a billion dollars flowed out of the system, The...     Dozens of Carved Layers Compose Vivid Linocut Prints of Cats and Bouquets by Vanessa Lubach
    Norfolk-based artist Vanessa Lubach likens her printmaking practice to that of oil painting and draws on the latter to inform her vibrant compositions. ‚ÄúI linocut like a painter and paint like a linocutter, and the two disciplines work together to inform and enhance each other,‚Äù she tells Colossal. Whether depicting bunches of dahlias and cosmos in a ceramic pitcher or an enchanting forest landscape, Lubach‚Äôs works center on quiet moments in domestic interiors or out among nature.     Daoming Town in Sichuan Province, China, is known for its bamboo weaving traditions. ‚ÄúThe practice,‚Äù says Archi-Union Architects, ‚Äúis more than a rural industry. It is an integral part of the way families in the town spend time together and how neighbors visit with each another.‚Äù One of the firm‚Äôs projects titled ‚ÄúIn Bamboo‚Äù is an homage to this rich local custom. Âπ≥Âè∞ÊîæÊï∞ÊçÆÔºå‰∫éÊòØÂ∞±ÊÉ≥Âà∞‰∫Ü‰ª•ÂâçÁî®ËøáÁöÑ LeanCloudÔºåÁü•ÂêçÁöÑÂçöÂÆ¢ËØÑËÆ∫Â∫îÁî® Valine Â∞±ÊòØÁî®ÁöÑËøô‰∏™ÊúçÂä°ÂïÜÔºåÂü∫Êú¨‰∏äËä±‰∏ç‰∫Ü‰ªÄ‰πàÈí±ÔºåËÄå‰∏î‰ªñ‰ª¨ÁöÑÊñáÊ°£ÂÜôÁöÑÂæà‰∏∞ÂØåÔºåÁõ∏ÂΩì‰∏çÈîô„ÄÇÁº∫ÁÇπÊòØÈÉ®ÂàÜÂäüËÉΩÈúÄË¶ÅËá™Â∑±ÁöÑÂüüÂêçÔºåËÄå‰∏îË¶ÅÊòØÂ§áÊ°àËøáÁöÑÂüüÂêç„ÄÇ È°πÁõÆÂºÄÊ∫êÂú∞ÂùÄÔºöhttps://github.com/TankNee/AnonymousQuestionBox ‰πãÂâçÊàë‰πüÊâìÁÆóÂÅö‰∏Ä‰∏™‰ΩøÁî®Êú¨Âú∞Êï∞ÊçÆÂ∫ìÁöÑÂàÜÊîØÔºåËøôÊ†∑Â∞±ËÉΩÁõ¥Êé•ÈÉ®ÁΩ≤Âà∞ railway ËøôÊ†∑ÁöÑÂπ≥Âè∞‰∏ä‰∫ÜÔºàÊàëÊòØÂø´ÂÜôÂÆå‰∫ÜÊâçÂèëÁé∞ÊúâËøôÊ†∑‰∏Ä‰∏™Âπ≥Âè∞Ôºâ„ÄÇ ÊâÄ‰ª•Êàë‰ª¨ÈúÄË¶Å‰ª•‰∏ãÂáÜÂ§áÔºö ‰∏Ä‰∏™ LeanCloud Ë¥¶Âè∑ ‰∏Ä‰∏™Â§áÊ°àËøáÁöÑÂüüÂêç ‰∏Ä‰∏™ GitHub Ë¥¶Âè∑ ÈÉ®ÁΩ≤Ê≠•È™§ È¶ñÂÖàÊâìÂºÄ LeanCloud Âπ≥Âè∞ÔºåÂàõÂª∫‰∏Ä‰∏™Êñ∞Â∫îÁî®Ôºö ÂàõÂª∫Â∫îÁî® ÈÄâÊã©ÂÖçË¥πÁâàÂç≥ÂèØÔºåÂÆåÂÖ®Ë∂≥Â§ü„ÄÇ ÁÑ∂ÂêéÂâçÂæÄÂ∫îÁî®ÁöÑËÆæÁΩÆ-Â∫îÁî®Âá≠ËØÅÈ°µÈù¢‰øùÂ≠òÂá≠ËØÅ‰ø°ÊÅØÔºö ÁêÜËÆ∫‰∏äËøô‰∏™‰∏¥Êó∂ÊúçÂä°Âô®Âú∞ÂùÄÊòØÂèØ‰ª•Áî®ÁöÑÔºå‰∏çËøáÊàëËøòÊòØÂª∫ËÆÆ‰ΩøÁî®Ëá™Â∑±ÁöÑÂüüÂêç„ÄÇ ÁÑ∂ÂêéÁÇπÂáªÊï∞ÊçÆÂ≠òÂÇ®-ÁªìÊûÑÂåñÊï∞ÊçÆ-ÂàõÂª∫ Class ÂàõÂª∫ÁªìÊûÑÊï∞ÊçÆÁ±ª Ê≠§Â§ÑÊàë‰ª¨ÈúÄË¶ÅÂàõÂª∫‰∏â‰∏™Á±ªÔºåÂàÜÂà´ÊòØÔºö AnswerÔºöÂ≠òÊîæÂõûÁ≠î QuestionÔºöÂ≠òÊîæÊèêÈóÆ SettingsÔºöÂ≠òÊîæ‰∏Ä‰∫õËÆæÁΩÆ‰ø°ÊÅØÔºå‰æãÂ¶ÇÈ°µÈù¢Ê†áÈ¢ò Êé•‰∏ãÊù•Êàë‰ª¨ÂèØ‰ª•ÁÇπÂáªÊù•Âú® vercel ‰∏äÈÉ®ÁΩ≤ÊèêÈóÆÁÆ±„ÄÇÁéØÂ¢ÉÂèòÈáèÈúÄË¶ÅÊ≠£Á°ÆÂ°´ÂÜôÔºåÂê¶ÂàôÂèØËÉΩÂºïÂèëÊú™Áü•ÈîôËØØ„ÄÇ PORTÔºàÂøÖÈúÄÔºâÔºöËøêË°åÁ´ØÂè£ÔºåÁõ¥Êé•Â°´ÂÜô 4000 Â∞±Â•Ω„ÄÇ LEANCLOUD_APP_IDÔºàÂøÖÈúÄÔºâÔºöÂ°´ÂÜô‰∏äÊñáËé∑ÂèñÂà∞ÁöÑ LeanCloud Â∫îÁî® APP ID ‰ø°ÊÅØ„ÄÇ LEANCLOUD_APP_KEYÔºàÂøÖÈúÄÔºâÔºöÂ°´ÂÜô‰∏äÊñáËé∑ÂèñÂà∞ÁöÑ LeanCloud Â∫îÁî® APP KEY ‰ø°ÊÅØ„ÄÇ LEANCLOUD_SERVER_URLÔºàÂøÖÈúÄÔºâÔºöÂ°´ÂÜô‰∏äÊñáËé∑ÂèñÂà∞ÁöÑ LeanCloud Â∫îÁî®ÊúçÂä°Âô®Âú∞ÂùÄ‰ø°ÊÅØ„ÄÇ USER_KEYÔºàÂøÖÈúÄÔºâÔºöÊèêÈóÆÁÆ±ÁôªÂΩïÁöÑÂØÜÁ†ÅÔºåÊ≥®ÊÑè‰øùÊä§ÈöêÁßÅ„ÄÇ MAILER_ACCOUNTÔºöSMTP ÈÇÆÁÆ±Ë¥¶Êà∑Ôºà‰∏∫‰∫ÜÁªôÊèêÈóÆÁÆ±ÁöÑ‰∏ª‰∫∫ÂèëÈÄÅÈÇÆ‰ª∂ÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ÈúÄË¶Å‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈÇÆÁÆ±Ë¥¶Âè∑Ôºâ„ÄÇ MAILER_PASSWORDÔºöÈÇÆÁÆ±ÂØÜÁ†Å„ÄÇ MAILER_HOSTÔºö SMTP ÊúçÂä°ÁöÑÂüüÂêçÔºà‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºösmtp.163.comÔºâ„ÄÇ Â°´ÂÜôÂÆåÊàê‰πãÂêéÁ≠âÂæÖÈÉ®ÁΩ≤Âç≥ÂèØÔºÅ Á§∫‰æãÊèêÈóÆÁÆ±ËØ∑Êü•ÁúãÔºö https://anonymous-question-box.vercel.app/ https://qb.tanknee.cn ÁÆ°ÁêÜÂëòÁî®Êà∑ÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄöËøáÁÇπÂáªÊ†áÈ¢òÊù•ËøõÂÖ•ÁÆ°ÁêÜÈ°µÈù¢Ôºö ËæìÂÖ•ÂØÜÁ†ÅÔºÅ ¬† ÁôªÂΩïÊàêÂäü‰πãÂêéÂÜçÊ¨°ÁÇπÂáªÊ†áÈ¢òÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄÄÂá∫ÁÆ°ÁêÜÁä∂ÊÄÅ„ÄÇ
    Â∞ëÊï∞Ê¥æÊÄùËÄÉ 018ÔºöÊñ∞‰ºöÂëòÔºåÊñ∞ÂÜÖÊ†∏
    Matrix È¶ñÈ°µÊé®Ëçê Matrix¬†ÊòØÂ∞ëÊï∞Ê¥æÁöÑÂÜô‰ΩúÁ§æÂå∫ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨‰∏ªÂº†ÂàÜ‰∫´ÁúüÂÆûÁöÑ‰∫ßÂìÅ‰ΩìÈ™åÔºåÊúâÂÆûÁî®‰ª∑ÂÄºÁöÑÁªèÈ™å‰∏éÊÄùËÄÉ„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨‰ºö‰∏çÂÆöÊúüÊåëÈÄâ Matrix ÊúÄ‰ºòË¥®ÁöÑÊñáÁ´†ÔºåÂ±ïÁ§∫Êù•Ëá™Áî®Êà∑ÁöÑÊúÄÁúüÂÆûÁöÑ‰ΩìÈ™åÂíåËßÇÁÇπ„ÄÇ ÊñáÁ´†‰ª£Ë°®‰ΩúËÄÖ‰∏™‰∫∫ËßÇÁÇπÔºåÂ∞ëÊï∞Ê¥æ‰ªÖÂØπÊ†áÈ¢òÂíåÊéíÁâàÁï•‰Ωú‰øÆÊîπ„ÄÇ Â∞èÁ∫¢‰π¶‰∏çÊòØÊàëÊìÖÈïø‰ΩøÁî®ÁöÑÂπ≥Âè∞ÔºåÊàëÂú®ÈÇ£Èáå‰πüÊ≤°ÊúâÂ§öÂ∞ëÁ≤â‰∏ù„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊúÄËøë‰∏ÄÊù°ÂÖ≥‰∫é Palm ËÄÅËÆæÂ§áÁöÑÂ∏ñÂ≠êÔºåÂç¥ÂºïÊù•‰∫Ü 200 Â§öÊù°ËØÑËÆ∫ÔºåËÄåËØÑËÆ∫ÂÜÖÂÆπÊõ¥ÊòØËÆ©ÊàëÊ≥™Â•î„ÄÇÂ∞§ÂÖ∂‰ª§ÊàëÊÑèÂ§ñÁöÑÊòØÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫ÊàëÊèêÂà∞‰∫ÜÁÖÆÊú∫Á§æÂå∫‚Äî‚ÄîÊàëËµ∞ÂÖ•‰∫íËÅîÁΩëË°å‰∏öÁöÑÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÊ≠•„ÄÅÂ∞ëÊï∞Ê¥æÁöÑÂü∫Á°ÄÂíåÂâçË∫´ÔºåËØÑËÆ∫Âå∫Âá∫Áé∞‰∫ÜÂæàÂ§öÂΩìÂπ¥ÁöÑËÄÅÁî®Êà∑„ÄÇËøáÂéªÂçÅÂ§öÂπ¥‰∫ÜÔºå‰ªñ‰ª¨‰πüËÆ∏Â∑≤Áªè‰∏∫‰∫∫Áà∂ÊØç„ÄÅ‰∫ã‰∏öÊúâÊàêÔºåÂç¥‰æùÁÑ∂ÊÄÄÂøµÈÇ£ÊÆµÁæéÂ•ΩÁöÑÊó∂ÂÖâ„ÄÇ Á°ÆÂÆûÔºåËøêËê•ÁÖÆÊú∫Á§æÂå∫ÁöÑ‰∏âÂπ¥Ôºå‰πüÊòØÊàëÊúÄÂø´‰πêÁöÑÊó∂ÂÖâ‰πã‰∏ÄÔºöÊØèÂ§©ÊäòËÖæËá™Â∑±ÂñúÊ¨¢ÁöÑËÆæÂ§áÂíåËΩØ‰ª∂ÔºåÁùÅÂºÄÁúºÁùõÔºåÂ∞±Áî®ÂøÉÈòÖËØªÂíåÁ≠õÈÄâÊØè‰∏ÄÊù°Á≤æÂçéÂ∏ñÂ≠êÔºåÊúüÂæÖÁùÄÁ§æÂå∫ÈáåÂá∫Áé∞ÁöÑÂêÑÁßçÁâõ‰∫∫„ÄÇÂú®ÂΩìÊó∂ÁöÑÂêÑÁ±ªÊäÄÊúØÁ§æÂå∫‰∏≠ÔºåÁÖÆÊú∫Á§æÂå∫ËÇØÂÆö‰∏çÁÆóËßÑÊ®°ÊúÄÂ§ß„ÄÅÊäÄÊúØÊúÄÂº∫ÁöÑÔºå‰ΩÜ‰∏ÄÂÆöÊòØÊ∞õÂõ¥ÊúÄÂ•Ω„ÄÅÊúÄÂ∞äÈáçÁî®Êà∑ÁöÑ„ÄÇ‰πüÂ∞±ÊòØÈÄöËøáËøêËê•ËøôÊ†∑‰∏Ä‰∏™Á§æÂå∫ÔºåËÆ©ÊàëËÆ§ËØÜÂà∞‰∫Ü‰∫íËÅîÁΩë„ÄåÂÖ±Âàõ„ÄçÁöÑÂäõÈáèÔºåÂüã‰∏ã‰∫ÜÂÅö‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂÖ±ÂàõÂπ≥Âè∞ÁöÑÂàõ‰∏öÁêÜÊÉ≥„ÄÇ Á∫µÊúâÂÜçÂ•ΩÁöÑÊÉ≥Ê≥ïÔºåÈÉΩË¶Å‰ªéÁúº‰∏ãËÉΩÂÅöÁöÑ‰∫ãÊÉÖÂºÄÂßã„ÄÇ‰Ωú‰∏∫ÁôΩÊâãËµ∑ÂÆ∂ÁöÑÂàõ‰∏öËÄÖÔºåÂÖàÂÅö„ÄåÂÜÖÂÆπÂÖ±Âàõ„ÄçÊòØÊúÄÁé∞ÂÆûÂèØË°åÁöÑÂàáÂÖ•ÁÇπ„ÄÇ‰∫éÊòØÔºåÂú®ÁÖÆÊú∫ËÆ∫Âùõ‰πãÂêéÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Âª∫Á´ã‰∫ÜÂ∞ëÊï∞Ê¥æÔºåËÅöÁÑ¶„ÄåÂ∫îÁî®Êé®Ëçê„ÄçËøô‰∏ÄÂûÇÁõ¥È¢ÜÂüüÔºåÊë∏Á¥¢Âá∫‰∏ÄÂ•ó‰ΩúËÄÖËá™Áî±Âàõ‰ΩúÔºåÁªèÁºñËæëÂÆ°ÊîπÔºåÂÜçÁ≤æÈÄâÊé®ËçêÁöÑÁã¨ÂÆ∂Ê®°Âºè„ÄÇ ÂÄºÂæóÂ∫ÜÂπ∏ÁöÑÊòØÔºåÂ∞ëÊï∞Ê¥æÁöÑÂª∫Á´ãÈÄÇÈÄ¢ÁßªÂä®‰∫íËÅîÁΩëËµ∑È£ûÔºåÂ∫îÁî®ÁúüÊ≠£ÂèòÊàê‰∫ÜÊï∞Â≠óÁîüÊ¥ªÁöÑÂÖ•Âè£ÔºåÁü•ËØÜ‰ªòË¥π‰πüÊ∏êÊ∏êÂÖ¥Ëµ∑„ÄÇÂ∞ëÊï∞Ê¥æÊ≤°ÊúâÂ∞ÜÂú®Â∫îÁî®Êé®ËçêÁßØÁ¥ØÁöÑÊµÅÈáèÁõ¥Êé•ÂπøÂëäÂèòÁé∞Ôºå‰πüÊ≤°ÊúâËµ∞Ë¥©ÂçñÁÑ¶ËôëÊàñÁæ§ÁªÑËê•ÈîÄÁöÑ„ÄåÊç∑ÂæÑ„Äç„ÄÇÁõ∏ÂèçÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÈÄâÊã©Ëøõ‰∏ÄÊ≠•ÊåñÊéòÂ∫îÁî®‰πãÂêéÂíå‰πã‰∏äÁöÑËØùÈ¢òÔºöÁ°¨‰ª∂„ÄÅÊúçÂä°„ÄÅÂú∫ÊôØ„ÄÅÁîüÊÄÅÔºõÂá≠ÂÄüÂú®ÊïàÁéáÂ∑•ÂÖ∑ÊñπÈù¢ÁöÑ‰∏ì‰∏öÁßØÁ¥ØÔºåÊàë‰ª¨‰πüÂæó‰ª•ÂàùÊ≠•Âª∫Á´ã‰∫ÜËá™Â∑±ÁöÑ‰ªòË¥πÂÜÖÂÆπ‰ΩìÁ≥ªÔºõËôΩÁÑ∂ÂÜÖÂÆπ‰ªòË¥πÁöÑËê•Êî∂ËßÑÊ®°‰∏çÂ§ßÔºå‰ΩÜÂè£Á¢ë‰∏çÈîôÔºå‰πüËÉΩ‰∏ÄÁõ¥ËâØÊÄßËøêËΩ¨Âíå‰∫ßÂá∫„ÄÇ Ëøô‰∏™ËøáÁ®ã‰∏≠ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨‰πüÂØπ‰∫éÊï∞Â≠óÁîüÊ¥ª‰∏≠ÁöÑÂ∑•ÂÖ∑„ÄÅÊñπÊ≥ï‰∏éÊïàÁéáÊúâ‰∫ÜÊõ¥‚Ä¶
    ÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®ËÉΩ‰ª£ÊõøÈôçÂéãËçØÂêóÔºüÈÄöËøáËøêÂä®ÈôçË°ÄÂéãÊó∂Ë¶ÅÊ≥®ÊÑè‰ªÄ‰πàÔºü
    „Ää‰∏≠ÂõΩÈ´òË°ÄÂéãÈò≤Ê≤ªÊåáÂçóÔºà2018‰øÆËÆ¢ÁâàÔºâ„Äã‰∏≠Â∞ÜÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®Á°ÆÂÆö‰∏∫È´òË°ÄÂéãÁöÑÈò≤Ê≤ªÊâãÊÆµ‰πã‰∏ÄÔºåËßÑÂæãÁöÑÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®Âú®Èôç‰ΩéË°ÄÂéãÊñπÈù¢ÁöÑ‰ΩúÁî®ÊòØÊòæËëóÁöÑÔºåÈïøÊúüËßÑÂæãÁöÑÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®ËÉΩ‰ΩøÈ´òË°ÄÂéãÊÇ£ËÄÖÁöÑÊî∂Áº©ÂéãÈôç‰Ωé12.3mmHgÔºåËàíÂº†ÂéãÈôç‰Ωé6.1mmHg„ÄÇÁõ∏ÊØî‰∫éËçØÁâ©Ê≤ªÁñóÔºåÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®ÁöÑÊØíÂâØ‰ΩúÁî®Â∞èÔºå‰∏îÁªèÊµéÊàêÊú¨Êõ¥‰Ωé„ÄÇ ÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®Êúâ‰ª£ÊõøËçØÁâ©Ê≤ªÁñóÁöÑÂèØËÉΩÂêóÔºü ÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®ËÉΩÂê¶‰ª£ÊõøËçØÁâ©Ê≤ªÁñóÂàô‰∏ªË¶ÅÂèñÂÜ≥‰∫éÊÇ£ËÄÖÁöÑË°ÄÂéãÊ∞¥Âπ≥Ôºå‰∏¥Â∫ä‰∏äÂ∞ÜË°ÄÂéãÊ∞¥Âπ≥ÂàíÂàÜ‰∏∫5‰∏™Á≠âÁ∫ßÔºàËØ¶ËßÅË°® 1ÔºâÔºå‰ªéÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®ÂºïËµ∑Ë°ÄÂéã‰∏ãÈôçÁöÑÂπÖÂ∫¶Êù•ÁúãÔºåË°ÄÂéãÂ§Ñ‰∫éÊ≠£Â∏∏È´òÂÄºËåÉÂõ¥ÂÜÖÁöÑÊÇ£ËÄÖ‰ªéÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®‰∏≠ÁöÑËé∑ÁõäÊúÄ‰∏∫ÊòéÊòæÔºåËßÑÂæãÁöÑÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®ËÉΩÂ§ü‰ΩøÂÖ∂Ë°ÄÂéãÊÅ¢Â§ç‰∏∫Ê≠£Â∏∏Ë°ÄÂéãÔºõ1Á∫ßÈ´òË°ÄÂéãÊÇ£ËÄÖÂú®‰øùÊåÅËâØÂ•ΩÁîüÊ¥ª‰π†ÊÉØÁöÑÂü∫Á°Ä‰∏äÊúâÂèØËÉΩÈÄöËøáÂçïÁ∫ØÁöÑÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®Â∞ÜË°ÄÂéãÈôç‰ΩéËá≥Ê≠£Â∏∏ËåÉÂõ¥ÂÜÖÔºõÂØπ‰∫é2Á∫ßÈ´òË°ÄÂéãÊÇ£ËÄÖÊù•ËØ¥ÔºåÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®ÂàôÂèØ‰ª•‰Ωú‰∏∫ËæÖÂä©Ê≤ªÁñóÊâãÊÆµÔºåÈÄöËøáËßÑÂæãÁöÑÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®ÂèØ‰ª•ËææÂà∞ÂáèÂ∞ëÊúçËçØÂâÇÈáèÁöÑÁõÆÁöÑÔºõËÄå3Á∫ßÈ´òË°ÄÂéãÊÇ£ËÄÖÂú®ÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®‰∏≠ÈÄöÂ∏∏‰ºöÈù¢‰∏¥ËæÉÈ´òÁöÑËøêÂä®È£éÈô©ÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§‰∏çÂª∫ËÆÆÂú®Áº∫Â∞ëÂåªÂä°ÁõëÁù£ÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÂçïÁã¨ËøõË°åÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®„ÄÇ Ë°® 1ÔºöË°ÄÂéãÊ∞¥Âπ≥ÂàÜÁ∫ß ‰ªÄ‰πàÊ†∑ÁöÑÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®ËÉΩÂ§üÊúâÊïàÈôç‰ΩéË°ÄÂéãÔºü ËøêÂä®ÂºïËµ∑ÁöÑË°ÄÂéãÈôç‰ΩéÊòØÊúâ‰∏•Ê†ºËß¶ÂèëÊù°‰ª∂ÁöÑÔºåÂπ∂‰∏çÊòØ‚ÄúÂæÆÂæÆÂá∫Ê±ó‚ÄùÂ∞±ËÉΩËææÂà∞Èôç‰ΩéË°ÄÂéãÁöÑÁõÆÁöÑ„ÄÇÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®Áî±ËøêÂä®Âë®Êúü„ÄÅËøêÂä®È¢ëÁéá„ÄÅËøêÂä®Êó∂Èó¥„ÄÅËøêÂä®Âº∫Â∫¶Á≠âÂá†‰∏™Âü∫Êú¨Ë¶ÅÁ¥†ÁªÑÊàêÔºåÊåÅÁª≠8Âë®‰ª•‰∏ä„ÄÅÊØèÂë®3Ê¨°‰ª•‰∏ä„ÄÅÊØèÊ¨°ÊåÅÁª≠20ÂàÜÈíü‰ª•‰∏äÁöÑ‰∏≠Á≠âÂº∫Â∫¶ÊúâÊ∞ßËøêÂä®ÊòØËÉΩÂ§üÊúâÊïàÈôç‰ΩéË°ÄÂéãÁöÑÊúÄ‰ΩéËøêÂä®Ê†áÂáÜÔºå‰ª•‰∏äË¶ÅÁ¥†‰∏≠ÁöÑ‰ªª‰Ωï‰∏Ä‰∏™Ëææ‰∏çÂà∞Ë¶ÅÊ±ÇÈÉΩÂæàÈöæ‰ΩøË°ÄÂéãÈôç‰Ωé„ÄÇ Âú®‰ª•‰∏äÁöÑË¶ÅÁ¥†‰∏≠ÔºåËøêÂä®Âº∫Â∫¶ÊòØÂΩ±ÂìçÈôçÂéãÊïàÊûúÊúÄ‰∏∫ÂÖ≥ÈîÆÔºå‰πüÊòØÊúÄÈöæÊääÊéßÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∏™Ë¶ÅÁ¥†Ôºå‰∏≠Á≠âÂèä‰ª•‰∏äÁöÑËøêÂä®Âº∫Â∫¶ÊâçËÉΩÂ§üÂºïËµ∑Ë°ÄÂéãÁöÑÊúâÊïàÈôç‰Ωé„ÄÇËøêÂä®Âº∫Â∫¶Â∏∏Áî®ÊúÄÂ§ßÂøÉÁéáÁöÑÁôæÂàÜÊØîÊù•ÁïåÂÆöÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÊúâÂèØ‰ª•ÁõëÊµãÂÆûÊó∂ÂøÉÁéáÁöÑÊâãÁéØÊàñÊâãË°®ÔºåÂú®ËøêÂä®‰∏≠ÂøÉÁéáËææÂà∞ÊúÄÂ§ßÂøÉÁéáÁöÑ70%Âç≥ÂèØËßÜ‰∏∫‰∏≠Á≠âÂº∫Â∫¶ÔºåÊúÄÂ§ßÂøÉÁéáÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄöËøá‚Äú220-Âπ¥ÈæÑ‚ÄùÊù•‰º∞ÁÆó„ÄÇ‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºå‰∏Ä‰Ωç30Â≤ÅÁöÑÈùíÂπ¥‰∫∫Ôºå‰ªñÁöÑÊúÄÂ§ßÂøÉÁéáÁ∫¶‰∏∫220-30=190Ôºå190√ó70%‚âà133ÔºåÂΩì‰ªñÂú®ËøêÂä®‰∏≠ÁöÑÂøÉÁéáËææÂà∞ÊØèÂàÜÈíü133Ê¨°‰ª•‰∏äÊó∂Âç≥ÂèØ‚Ä¶

    JavaScript Interview Questions Part 1
    Wouldn‚Äôt it be great if you knew exactly what questions a hiring manager would be asking you in your next job interview? Hoisting is the default behaviour of JavaScript where all the variable and function declarations are moved on top. // Example of Global Scope hoistedVariable = 3; console.log(hoistedVariable); // outputs 3 even when the variable is declared after it is initialized var hoistedVariable; // -------------------- // Example of Local Scope function doSomething(){ x = 33; console.log(x); // Outputs 33 since the local variable ‚Äúx‚Äù is hoisted inside the local scope var x; } In JavaScript, both the keywords var and let are used to declare variables. let is block-scope. var is function scoped. let does not allow to redeclare variables. var allows to redeclare variables‚Ä¶  ( 3 min )
    Building a live chart with Deno, WebSockets, Chart.js and Materialize
    Introduction This is a self-contained example of a real-time chart powered by Deno, Web Sockets, Chart.js, and Materialize. Deno is a simple and secure runtime for JavaScript and TypeScript that uses V8. Deno, just like Materialize, is also written in Rust. In this demo, we will build a simple live dashboard app that displays real-time data from a Deno Web Socket server. Deno will then connect to Materialize and TAIL our live materialized view to get the latest data and display it in a real-time chart using Chart.js. Here is a quick overview of the project: A mock service to continually generate user score events. Redpanda instance to store the user score events in a topic. Materialize instance that is connected to the Redpanda instance and ingests the data from the topic in a live mater‚Ä¶  ( 6 min )

    Getting intimate with CI/CD and CI/CD Pipeline
    Introduction: In my previous article Why CI/CD? How was a life without CI/CD & how is it now? I talked about the Why of CI/CD. If you read that, got the concept and wanna hear more about CI/CD then In this article we are going to ding more into the concepts of CI/CD. So, CI/CD is simply a method to frequently deliver apps to customers by introducing automation into the stages of app development. The main concepts attributed to CI/CD are continuous integration, continuous delivery, and continuous deployment. CI/CD is a solution to the problems integrating new code can cause for development and operations teams (AKA "integration hell"). Specifically, CI/CD introduces ongoing automation and continuous monitoring throughout the lifecycle of apps, from integration and testing phases to del‚Ä¶  ( 8 min )

    Create a Discord Bot in Python

    How has my portfolio evolved?
    I know my portfolio is not the best as compared to portfolios of other amazing developers out there but 'Content is king' and I am working on it to make it better and better The purpose of my portfolio is to provide value to other developers from my journey and I hope I make it happen. As a developer portfolio is something that you must have. It's a place where you can share about your projects, education qualifications, journey as a developer, tech stacks, and write blogs on your site. Portfolio is a digital garden for you I went through 4 iterations of designing my portfolio. List of my portfolio iterations are: 1.First Portfolio. PORTFOLIO 1 Stack Used- HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Hosted on netlify. 2.Second Portfolio. PORTFOLIO 2 Vue and Flask. It looks like some sort of profile page on a social media website. Stack Used- Vue, Bulma, Flask (For Blogs), frontend on Netlify, backend on Heroku. 3.Third Portfolio PORTFOLIO 3 Stack Used- Nuxt JS, Bulma, frontend on Netlify, Notion for storing blogs. 4.Portfolio 4 (Current) PORTFOLIO 3 Stack Used- Nuxt JS, Bulma, frontend on Netlify, Blogs coming soon. Thanks for reading.  ( 2 min )
    Counting all words across markdown files ~ CLI
    Quite a while ago, my good friend and colleague @inhuofficial asked me if I knew how many words I'd written. And although I'm at 800+ articles, I had no idea how many words this was. So I decided to find a solution to give him an answer and shock myself (and maybe even you?) This solution will use the command-line interface (CLI), which is the simplest way to do it. The first step is to count words in some text; luckily for us, Unix already has this command called wc (word count). To use it, we can simply use a command like this: wc -w <<< "Some random words" This should output 3 as there are three words in this string. Now that we know how to count words, we need a way to extract the actual content from our markdown file. There are several Unix markdown parsers. If you have a favorite ‚Ä¶  ( 3 min )
    Building Blog with Nuxt 2 and Contentrain Headless CMS
    When I first heard about Contentrain I was a bit sceptical. At this time I already had experiences with several Content Management Systems like Storyblok, Contentful, and Contentstack, so wasn't particularly sure how Contentrain will differ from them. Basically, what will make me wanna use Contentrain instead of these already known solutions. I thought it will be just another tool that offers exactly same functionality. My experience with Contentrain was really, really good. It was so great that I decided to write an article about it üöÄ The first step when you create a new account in Contentrain will be this nice looking dashboard with a short tutorial on what you can do with Contentrain The first step we will do, we will create a new project. Projects are like a main entitites in Conte‚Ä¶  ( 4 min )
    Free Resources for Devs
    Here are some of my most amazing dev resources. I frequently use these resources for a design inspirations for my apps. Free for Dev Dev Resource Do you know some other resources like this? Post it in the comment so others can know as well üòÄ  ( 2 min )
    Create a Docker based Self Hosted GitHub runner Linux container
    Overview All the code used in this tutorial can be found on my GitHub project: docker-github-runner-linux. Welcome to Part 2 of my series: Self Hosted GitHub Runner containers on Azure. In part one of this series, we looked at how we can create a windows container image using docker and then running our self hosted GitHub runners as containers. In this part we will focus on building a Linux based Ubuntu image instead. In subsequent parts, we will look at how we can utilize Azure to store and run our containers in the cloud using Azure Container Registry (ACR), Azure Container Instances (ACI) and Azure Container Apps (ACA) to run and scale our self hosted GitHub runners, instead of using a VM based approach with docker running inside of a VM. As also described in part one, before building‚Ä¶  ( 11 min )
    FoalTS 2022 survey is open!
    FoalTS 2022 survey is now open (yes, a few months late üôÉ)! Your responses to these questions are really valuable as they help me better understand what you need and how to improve the framework going forward üëå. I read every response carefully so feel free to say anything you have to say! üëâ The link to the survey. The survey closes on June 31.  ( 1 min )

    Phishion: Â∞èÁ±≥ÂàöÂºÄÂßãÊêûÁßªÂä®ÈÄö‰ø°‰∏öÂä°ÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÔºå‰∏∫‰∫ÜËê•ÈîÄÊé®ËøáÈÇ£ÁßçÊ≤°ÊúâÊúàÁßüÁöÑÁîµËØùÂç°ÔºåÊàëËßâÂæóÂÖÖ 100     zhishixiang: Ë∂ÅÁùÄÈ´òËÄÉÁªìÊùüÂêéÈó≤ÁùÄÊó†‰∫ãÔºåÂÖ•Èó®‰∫ÜÁΩëÈ°µÂíåÂ∞èÁ®ãÂ∫èÂºÄÂèëÔºåÂàöÂ≠¶ÂÆå ajax Ê≤°Â§ö‰πÖÔºåÊâìÁÆóÂÜô‰∏Ä‰∏™Â∞èÈ°πÁõÆ‰Ωú‰∏∫ÊÄªÁªìÔºå‰∫éÊòØ‰æøÊúâ‰∫ÜÊ≠§È°πÁõÆ„ÄÇ Êú¨È°πÁõÆÂü∫‰∫éÂâçÁ´ØËØ∑Ê±ÇÂêéÁ´Ø„ÄÅÂêéÁ´ØËÆ∞ÂΩïÊï∞ÊçÆÁöÑÊñπÂºèÁªüËÆ°ËÆøÂÆ¢Êï∞ÊçÆÔºå‰ΩøÂæóÈùôÊÄÅÁΩëÁ´ô‰πüÊã•Êúâ‰∫ÜÂ±ïÁ§∫ËÆøÂÆ¢Êï∞ÊçÆÁöÑÂäüËÉΩ„ÄÇ‰∏îÊú¨È°πÁõÆËøòÂà©Áî®‰∫Ü cookies Êù•Èò≤Ê≠¢ÈáçÂ§çÊèê‰∫§Êï∞ÊçÆÔºåÁ°Æ‰øùËÆ∞ÂΩïÁúüÂÆûËÆøÈóÆÈáè„ÄÇÊú¨Êù•ÊòØÊÉ≥Âè™ÁªôËá™Â∑±ÁöÑÁΩëÁ´ôÁî®ÁöÑÔºå‰ΩÜÂêéÈù¢ËøòÊòØÂÜ≥ÂÆöÂºÄÊ∫ê‰∫ÜÔºàËôΩÁÑ∂ js ËÑöÊú¨ÂºÄ‰∏çÂºÄÊ∫êÈÉΩÊó†ÊâÄË∞ìÔºâ„ÄÇ ÂêéÁ´ØÊê≠Âª∫Âú®‰∫ÜËÖæËÆØ‰∫ëÁöÑ serverless ‰∫ëÂáΩÊï∞‰∏äÔºåÂõΩÂÜÖËÆøÈóÆÈÄüÂ∫¶Â∫îËØ•ÊòØÊúâ‰øùËØÅÁöÑÔºåÁªèËøáÊµãËØïÂìçÂ∫îÊó∂Èó¥Âùá‰∏çË∂Ö 50ms Ôºå‰∏™‰∫∫ÊÑüËßâËøòÊòØÁõ∏ÂΩì‰∏çÈîôÁöÑ„ÄÇ È°πÁõÆÂú∞ÂùÄÔºö https://github.com/zhishixiang/visitorStatistic ÔºåÁî±‰∫éÂàöÂ≠¶Ê≤°Â§ö‰πÖÂõ†Ê≠§‰ª£Á†ÅÈùûÂ∏∏ÁÉÇÔºåÂ∏åÊúõÂ§ß‰Ω¨‰ª¨ËΩªÂñ∑„ÄÇ  ( 1 min )

    sandman511: Windows 11 ‰ºÅ‰∏öÁâà 21H2 22000.675 ‰ªªÂä°ÁÆ°ÁêÜÂô® cpu/ÂÜÖÂ≠ò /Á£ÅÁõòÈÉΩÊ≠£Â∏∏ÔºåGPU Âπ≥Êó∂ 5%Â∑¶Âè≥Ôºå‰ΩÜÂç°ÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄô‰ºöÂà∞ 50%Â∑¶Âè≥ÔºåÊ°åÈù¢Á™óÂè£ÁÆ°ÁêÜÂô®‰∏é Client Server Runtime Process ËøõÁ®ãÂêÑÂç† 25%Â∑¶Âè≥ÔºàÂàöÂàöÂèàÂç°‰∫ÜÔºåÊ°åÈù¢Á™óÂè£ÁÆ°ÁêÜÂô® GPU Âç†Áî®Ê≠£Â∏∏ÔºåClient Server Runtime Process Áã¨Âç† 60%Ôºâ 9:00 - 11:00 Ê≠£Â∏∏Ôºå11 ÁÇπÂ∑¶Âè≥ÂºÄÂßãÂç°Ôºå‰∏≠Âçà‰∏çÊ∏ÖÊ•ö 14:00-15:00 Ê≠£Â∏∏Ôºå15 ÁÇπÂ∑¶Âè≥ÂºÄÂßãÂç°ÔºåÊôö‰∏ä‰∏çÊ∏ÖÊ•ö ÈáçÂêØËØïËøáÔºåÂè™ÂºÄ‰∫Ü IDEA+‰ºÅ‰∏öÂæÆ‰ø°Ôºå‰πüÂç°

    jarl: Áúã‰∫ÜÊñáÁ´†ÊÑüËßâËøòÊòØ api ÂëÄ  ( 1 min )
    IceFireDB-SQLite: Interesting When P2P Meets SQLite
    corerman: IceFireDB-SQLite IceFireDB SQLite database is a decentralized SQLite database. Provide a convenient mechanism to build a global distributed database system. Support users to write data to IceFireDB using MySQL protocol. IceFireDB stores the data in the SQLite database and synchronizes the data among the nodes in the P2P automatic networking. current state For the content of the Wanxiang Hackathon, you can browse: https://github.com/IceFireDB/IceFireDB/tree/main/IceFireDB-SQLite How does it work? Compile and install cd IceFireDB-SQLite make IceFireDB-SQLite -h Application scenarios Build a decentralized SQLite database based on Mysql usage protocol  ( 1 min )
    [T ÊäÄÊúØÊ≤ôÈæô] Á∫ø‰∏äÊ¥ªÂä®‰∏®‰∫íËÅîÁΩë‚ÄúÊØï‰∏ö‚ÄùÂ≠£ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÊòØÊÄé‰πàË¢´‚ÄúÊØï‰∏ö‚ÄùÁöÑÔºü

    Ââç‰∏ÄÊÆµÊó∂Èó¥ÔºåÊàëÁöÑËÄÅÊúãÂèãÊ∑ÆÊôãÈò≥Ë∑üÊàëËØ¥Ôºå‰∏∫‰ªÄ‰πà‰∏çÂ∞Ü‰∏Ä‰∫õÊñáÁ´†ÂèòÊàêÊúóËØªÁâàÁöÑÂë¢ÔºüËøôÊ†∑ÂèØ‰ª•ËÆ©Êõ¥Â§öÂñúÊ¨¢Âê¨ÊúóËØªÁöÑÁà±Â•ΩËÄÖ‰ª¨‚ÄúÂê¨Âà∞‚ÄùÔºåËÄå‰∏çÊòØ‚ÄúÁúãÂà∞‚ÄùÂºÄÊ∫êÁöÑÊñáÁ´†ÔºüÂØπ‰∫éËøôÊ†∑ÁöÑÂª∫ËÆÆÔºåÊàëÊ¨£ÁÑ∂ÈááÁ∫≥„ÄÇ‰∫éÊòØÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÂèëËµ∑‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™Êñ∞ÁöÑÊúóËØªÊ†èÁõÆÔºöÂºÄÊ∫êÊúóËØªËÄÖ„ÄÇÂØπ‰∏Ä‰∫õÊñáÁ´†ÔºåÂ∞§ÂÖ∂ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∫õËØÑËÆ∫ÊÄßÁöÑÊñáÁ´†ÔºåËøõË°å‰∫ÜÊúóËØªÈÖçÈü≥„ÄÇ ÂæàÂø´ÔºåÂú®Ê∑ÆÊôãÈò≥Âà∂‰ΩúÂá∫Á¨¨‰∏ÄÁØáÊúóËØªÁâàÁöÑ„ÄäLinux Â§™Èöæ‰∫ÜÂêóÔºü‰Ω†ÈúÄË¶Å‰∫ÜËß£Ëøô‰∫îÁÇπ„ÄãÔºåÂπ∂Âú®‰ªñÁöÑÂ∏¶Âä®‰∏ãÔºåÂº†Èî¶Ëà™„ÄÅËã•ÊÑö„ÄÅÂÖ≠ÂºÄÁÆ±Á≠âÂºÄÊ∫êË¥°ÁåÆËÄÖ‰ª¨‰πüÁ∫∑Á∫∑Âä†ÂÖ•‰∫ÜÊúóËØªËÄÖË°åÂàóÔºåËøòÊúâÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑÂºÄÊ∫êÊúóËØªËÄÖ‰ª¨‰πüÂú®ÁßØÊûÅÂΩïÂà∂‰∏≠„ÄÇÊÑüÂÖ¥Ë∂£Âä†ÂÖ•ÂºÄÊ∫êÊúóËØªËÄÖË°åÂàóÁöÑÔºåËØ∑ÂæÆ‰ø°ÂÖ¨‰ºóÂè∑ÂÜÖÁßÅ‰ø°Êàë„ÄÇ Âú®Ëøô‰∫õÈü≥È¢ëÂèëÂ∏ÉÂêéÔºåÊàë‰ª¨‰πüÊî∂Âà∞‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∫õÊí≠ÂÆ¢Áà±Â•ΩËÄÖÁöÑÂª∫ËÆÆÔºåÂ∏åÊúõÂú®ÈÄöÁî®ÁöÑÊí≠ÂÆ¢ÂÆ¢Êà∑Á´Ø‰∏ä‰πüËÉΩËÆ¢ÈòÖ„ÄÅÊî∂Âê¨Âà∞Ëøô‰∫õÊúâÊÑè‰πâÁöÑÈü≥È¢ëËäÇÁõÆ„ÄÇ Âú®Êàë‰ª¨ÁöÑÊäÄÊúØÂêà‰ºô‰∫∫ÁôΩÂÆ¶ÊàêÁöÑÊîØÊåÅ‰∏ãÔºåÂæàÂø´ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Â∞±ÂºÄÂèë‰∫Ü‰∏§‰∏™Êí≠ÂÆ¢È¢ëÈÅìÔºö ÂºÄÊ∫êÊúóËØªËÄÖÔºöÁî±ÊúóËØªËÄÖ‰ª¨Ê∑±ÊÉÖÊúóËØªÂêÑÁßçÂÄºÂæóÂàÜ‰∫´ÁªôÂ§ßÂÆ∂ÁöÑÊñáÁ´†Ôºå‰∏ÄËà¨Êó∂ÈïøÂú® 10 ÂàÜÈíüÂ∑¶Âè≥„ÄÇ Á°¨Ê†∏ËßÇÂØüÔºöËøôÊòØÂØπÊàë‰ª¨ÊØèÂ§©ÁöÑ„ÄäÁ°¨Ê†∏ËßÇÂØü„ÄãÊ†èÁõÆÁöÑÈü≥È¢ëÈáçÂà∂Ôºå‰∏ÄËà¨Êó∂ÈïøÂú® 3 ÂàÜÈíüÂ∑¶Âè≥„ÄÇ Ëøô‰∏§‰∏™Êí≠ÂÆ¢È¢ëÈÅìÂèØ‰ª•Âú®ÂñúÈ©¨ÊãâÈõÖÂ∫îÁî®‰∏äÊ†πÊçÆÂêçÁß∞ÊêúÁ¥¢Âà∞Ôºõ‰πüÂèØ‰ª•ËãπÊûúÁöÑ‚ÄúÊí≠ÂÆ¢‚Äù„ÄÅ‚ÄúÂ∞èÂÆáÂÆô‚ÄùÁ≠âÈÄöÁî®ÂûãÊí≠ÂÆ¢ÂÆ¢Êà∑Á´ØÊêúÁ¥¢Âà∞„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†ÊêúÁ¥¢‰∏çÂà∞Ôºå‰πüÂèØ‰ª•Áõ¥Êé•ËæìÂÖ•ÂÆÉ‰ª¨ÁöÑ RSS Âú∞ÂùÄÔºö ÂºÄÊ∫êÊúóËØªËÄÖÔºö https://linux.cn/podcast.xml¬† Á°¨Ê†∏ËßÇÂØüÔºö https://linux.cn/insight.xml Ê¨¢ËøéÊî∂Âê¨ÔºÅ

Âú®Ëøô‰∏™ÂÖ®Êñ∞‰ΩìÁ≥ªÊû∂ÊûÑ‰∏ãÔºåCIPU¬†Âêë‰∏ãÂØπÊï∞ÊçÆ‰∏≠ÂøÉÁöÑËÆ°ÁÆó„ÄÅÂ≠òÂÇ®„ÄÅÁΩëÁªúËµÑÊ∫êÂø´ÈÄü‰∫ëÂåñÂπ∂ËøõË°åÁ°¨‰ª∂Âä†ÈÄüÔºåÂêë‰∏äÊé•ÂÖ•È£ûÂ§©‰∫ëÊìç‰ΩúÁ≥ªÁªüÔºåÂ∞ÜÂÖ®ÁêÉÊï∞Áôæ‰∏áÂè∞ÊúçÂä°Âô®ËøûÊàê‰∏ÄÂè∞Ë∂ÖÁ∫ßËÆ°ÁÆóÊú∫„ÄÇ¬† ÈòøÈáå‰∫ëÊô∫ËÉΩÊÄªË£ÅÂº†Âª∫ÈîãÂèëÂ∏É¬†CIPU ‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåCIPU¬†‰∏éËÆ°ÁÆóÁªìÂêàÔºåÂø´ÈÄüÊé•ÂÖ•‰∏çÂêåÁ±ªÂûãËµÑÊ∫êÁöÑÊúçÂä°Âô®ÔºåÂ∏¶Êù•ÁÆóÂäõÁöÑ‚Äú0‚ÄùÊçüËÄóÔºå‰ª•ÂèäÁ°¨‰ª∂Á∫ßÂÆâÂÖ®ÁöÑÂä†Âõ∫ÈöîÁ¶ªÔºõCIPU¬†‰∏éÂ≠òÂÇ®ÁªìÂêàÔºåÂØπÂ≠òÁÆóÂàÜÁ¶ªÊû∂ÊûÑÁöÑÂùóÂ≠òÂÇ®Êé•ÂÖ•ËøõË°åÁ°¨‰ª∂Âä†ÈÄüÔºå‰∫ëÁõòÂ≠òÂÇ®¬†IOPS¬†ÊúÄÈ´òÂèØËææ¬†300¬†‰∏áÔºåÈïøÂ∞æÊó∂Âª∂Èôç‰Ωé¬†50%ÔºõCIPU¬†‰∏éÁΩëÁªúÁªìÂêàÔºåÂèØÂØπÈ´òÂ∏¶ÂÆΩÁâ©ÁêÜÁΩëÁªúËøõË°åÁ°¨‰ª∂Âä†ÈÄüÔºåÊûÑÂª∫Â§ßËßÑÊ®°ÂºπÊÄß¬†RDMA¬†È´òÊÄßËÉΩÁΩëÁªúÔºåÊó∂Âª∂ÊúÄ‰ΩéÂèØËææ¬†5us„ÄÇ CIPU¬†Êû∂ÊûÑÁ§∫ÊÑèÂõæ Âü∫‰∫é¬†CIPU¬†ÂíåÈ£ûÂ§©ÁöÑÊñ∞‰∏Ä‰ª£‰∫ëËÆ°ÁÆóÊû∂ÊûÑ‰ΩìÁ≥ªÔºåÂú®ÈÄöÁî®ËÆ°ÁÆó„ÄÅÂ§ßÊï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÅ‰∫∫Â∑•Êô∫ËÉΩÁ≠âÊ†∏ÂøÉÂú∫ÊôØÁöÑËÆ°ÁÆóÊµãËØï‰∏≠Â±ïÁé∞‰∫Ü‰ºòË∂äÁöÑÊÄßËÉΩ„ÄÇÂú®ÈÄöÁî®ÂàÜÂ∏ÉÂºèËÆ°ÁÆóÈ¢ÜÂüüÔºåRedis¬†ÊÄßËÉΩÊèêÂçá‰∫Ü¬†68%„ÄÅMySQL¬†ÊèêÂçá‰∫Ü¬†60%ÔºåNginx¬†ÊèêÂçá‰∫Ü¬†30%ÔºõÈ´òÂêûÂêêÁ±ªÁöÑ‰∫íËÅîÁΩë‰∏öÂä°‰∏ä‰∫ë‰πãÂêéÔºåÊØîËá™Âª∫Áâ©ÁêÜÊú∫ÁöÑÈõÜÁæ§ÂêûÂêêÈáèÊèêÂçá‰∫Ü¬†30%Ôºå‰∏öÂä°È´òÂ≥∞ÊúüÂª∂Ëøü‰∏ãÈôç‰∫Ü¬†90%ÔºõÂú®Â§ßÊï∞ÊçÆÂíåAIÁ≠âËÆ°ÁÆó‰∏éÊï∞ÊçÆÂèåÂØÜÈõÜÂú∫ÊôØ‰∏ãÔºåÁõ∏ÊØî‰º†ÁªüÁöÑ¬†TCP¬†ÁΩëÁªúÔºåÂºπÊÄß¬†RDMA¬†È´òÊÄßËÉΩÁΩëÁªúÁöÑÂêûÂêêËÉΩÂäõÊèêÂçá¬†30%¬†‰ª•‰∏äÔºõ‰∫ëÂéüÁîüÊñπÈù¢ÔºåÂÆπÂô®ÂêØÂä®ÈÄüÂ∫¶Âø´‰∫Ü¬†350%ÔºåÂú®¬†Serverless Âú∫ÊôØ‰∏ã¬†6¬†ÁßíÂèØÊãâËµ∑¬†3000¬†‰∏™ÂºπÊÄßÂÆπÂô®ÂÆû‰æã„ÄÇ CIPU¬†ÁâπÊÄßÁÆÄ‰ªã ‰∏∫‰ªÄ‰πàË¶ÅÊúâ¬†CIPUÔºüÂº†Âª∫ÈîãËÆ§‰∏∫ÔºåËøáÂéªÂçÅÂ§öÂπ¥Ôºå‰∫ëËÆ°ÁÆóÊäÄÊúØÁªèÂéÜ‰∫Ü‰∏§‰∏™ÂèëÂ±ïÈò∂ÊÆµÔºöÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÈò∂ÊÆµÊòØÂàÜÂ∏ÉÂºèÂíåËôöÊãüÂåñÊäÄÊúØÊõø‰ª£‰∫ÜÂ§ßÂûãÊú∫ÔºåÊª°Ë∂≥‰∫ÜÂΩìÊó∂‰ºÅ‰∏öÊâÄÈúÄÁöÑÁÆóÂäõËßÑÊ®°ÔºõÁ¨¨‰∫åÈò∂ÊÆµÂá∫Áé∞‰∫ÜËµÑÊ∫êÊ±†ÂåñÊäÄÊúØÔºå‰ª•ÈòøÈáåÂ∑¥Â∑¥‰∏∫‰æãÔºåÈÄöËøáËÆ°ÁÆóÂ≠òÂÇ®ÂàÜÁ¶ªÊû∂ÊûÑÔºåÂ∞ÜËÆ°ÁÆó„ÄÅÂ≠òÂÇ®„ÄÅÁΩëÁªúËµÑÊ∫êÂàÜÂà´Ê±†ÂåñÔºåÁ™ÅÁ†¥‰∫ÜËßÑÊ®°ÂíåÁ®≥ÂÆöÊÄßÁöÑÁì∂È¢àÔºåÊèê‰æõ‰∫ÜË∂ÖÂ§ßËßÑÊ®°ÁöÑ‰∫ëËÆ°ÁÆóÊúçÂä°„ÄÇ ‰ΩÜÈöèÁùÄÊï∞ÊçÆÂØÜÈõÜÂûãËÆ°ÁÆóÂú∫ÊôØÁöÑÊôÆÂèäÔºåÁî®Êà∑ÂØπ‰ΩéÊó∂Âª∂„ÄÅÈ´òÂ∏¶ÂÆΩÁöÑÈúÄÊ±Ç‰πüË∂äÊù•Ë∂äÈ´òÔºå‰º†Áªü‰ª•¬†CPU¬†‰∏∫‰∏≠ÂøÉÁöÑËÆ°ÁÆó‰ΩìÁ≥ªÊû∂ÊûÑÊó†Ê≥ïÈÄÇÂ∫îËøô‰∏ÄË∂ãÂäø„ÄÇ‰∏∫‰∫ÜËß£ÂÜ≥Ëøô‰∏ÄÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÈòøÈáå‰∫ëÁõ∏ÂÖ≥Á†îÂèëÂõ¢ÈòüÊó©Âú®¬†2015¬†Âπ¥Â∞±ÂºÄÂßãÊäÄÊúØÊîªÂÖ≥ÔºåÂπ∂‰∫é¬†2017¬†Âπ¥Êé®Âá∫‰∏öÂÜÖÈ¶ñÊ¨æËôöÊãüÂåñÊçüËÄó‰∏∫Èõ∂ÁöÑÁ•ûÈæô‰∫ëÊúçÂä°Âô®„ÄÇÁªèËøáÂ§öÂπ¥Ëá™Á†îËø≠‰ª£ÔºåÁ•ûÈæô„ÄÅÂºπÊÄß¬†RDMA¬†Á≠âÊ†∏ÂøÉÊäÄÊúØ‰∏çÊñ≠Ê∑±ÂÖ•ÂûÇÁõ¥Êï¥ÂêàÔºåÊºîËøõÂá∫‰ª•¬†CIPU¬†‰∏∫‰∏≠ÂøÉÁöÑÂÖ®Êñ∞Êû∂ÊûÑÂΩ¢ÊÄÅÔºå‰∫ëËÆ°ÁÆóÂºÄÂßãËøõÂÖ•Á¨¨‰∏âÈò∂ÊÆµ„ÄÇ ÈòøÈáå‰∫ëËøò‰∏çÊñ≠Â§ØÂÆûÊäÄÊúØÂ∫ïÂ∫ßÔºåÂª∫Á´ã‰∫ÜËá™Á†îÁöÑËäØÁâá„ÄÅÊúçÂä°Âô®„ÄÅÈ£ûÂ§©Êìç‰ΩúÁ≥ªÁªüÁ≠âËΩØÁ°¨‰∏Ä‰ΩìÁöÑÂü∫Á°ÄËÆæÊñΩ„ÄÇËøô‰∫õÂü∫Á°ÄËÆæÊñΩÊúâÂäõÊîØÊíë‰∫ÜÈòøÈáå‰∫ë‰∫ßÂìÅÁöÑÂõõÂ§ßÊ†∏ÂøÉÔºöÁ•ûÈæôËÆ°ÁÆó„ÄÅÁõòÂè§Â≠òÂÇ®„ÄÅÊ¥õÁ•ûÁΩëÁªúÂíåÂÆâÂÖ®ÂÜÖÊ†∏„ÄÇÂú®ÂõΩÈôÖÊùÉÂ®ÅÊú∫ÊûÑ¬†Gartner¬†ÂèëÂ∏ÉÁöÑÂπ¥Â∫¶Êä•ÂëäÈáåÔºåÈòøÈáå‰∫ëËé∑ÂæóËÆ°ÁÆó„ÄÅÂ≠òÂÇ®„ÄÅÁΩëÁªú„ÄÅÂÆâÂÖ®¬†4¬†È°πÂçïÈ°πÊúÄÈ´òÂàÜ‰ª•Âèä¬†IaaS¬†Êï¥‰ΩìÂü∫Á°ÄËÆæÊñΩËÉΩÂäõÁöÑÂÖ®ÁêÉÊúÄÈ´òÂàÜ„ÄÇ
    ÂàÜË£Ç‰Ωø Linux Ë∂ÖË∂ä Windows ÁöÑÊ¢¶ÊÉ≥Á†¥ÁÅ≠‰∫Ü
    ÊúÄËøëÔºåThe Register ÁöÑ Liam Proven ÂÜô‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÁØáÂÖ≥‰∫é¬†ÊúÄÊÅº‰∫∫ÁöÑÊ°åÈù¢ Linux ÂèëË°åÁâà ÁöÑÊñáÁ´†„ÄÇ‰ªñÂêØÂèëÊàëÂÜô‰∫ÜËøôÁØáÊñáÁ´†„ÄÇ Proven ÊåáÂá∫ÔºåDistrowatch ÁõÆÂâçÂàóÂá∫‰∫ÜÂ§öËææ¬†270 ‰∏™ Linux ÂèëË°åÁâà„ÄÇÂΩìÁÑ∂ÔºåÊ≤°Êúâ‰∫∫ËÉΩÂ§üÈÉΩ‰∏Ä‰∏Ä‰∫ÜËß£ÊâÄÊúâÁöÑËøô‰∫õÂèëË°åÁâà„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊòØÔºåÁîöËá≥Âú® GNOME Âíå KDE ÁöÑÁïåÈù¢Â§ßËæ©ËÆ∫‰πãÂâçÔºå‰ªé Bash Âíå Zsh ‰πã‰∫âÂºÄÂßãÔºåÊàëÂ∞±‰∏ÄÁõ¥Âú®Êä•ÈÅì Linux Ê°åÈù¢ÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÊõæÁªèÊòØ‰∏ÄÊú¨Áé∞Âú®Â∑≤ÁªèÂÅúÂàäÁöÑÂêç‰∏∫„ÄäLinux Ê°åÈù¢„ÄãÊùÇÂøóÁöÑ‰∏ªÁºñÔºåÊàëÊÉ≥ÊàëÊØî‰ªª‰ΩïÂÖ∂‰ªñÁî®Ëøá Windows PC ‰πãÂ§ñÁöÑËÆ°ÁÆóÊú∫ÁöÑ‰∫∫‰ΩøÁî®ËøáÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑÊ°åÈù¢„ÄÇÁÆÄËÄåË®Ä‰πãÔºåÊàëË∂ÖÁà± Linux Ê°åÈù¢„ÄÇ ËÆ∏Â§ö Linux Ê°åÈù¢ÂèëË°åÁâàÈÉΩÂæàÊ£í„ÄÇÂ§öÂπ¥Êù•ÔºåÊàë‰∏ÄÁõ¥ÊòØ Linux Mint ÁöÑÂø†ÂÆûÁ≤â‰∏ù„ÄÇÊàë‰πüÂæàÂñúÊ¨¢ÂÖ∂ÂÆÉÊ°åÈù¢ÂèëË°åÁâàÔºöFedora„ÄÅopenSUSE„ÄÅUbuntu Âíå MX LinuxÔºåÊéíÂêç‰∏çÂàÜÂÖàÂêé„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊòØ‰Ω†Áü•ÈÅìÂêóÔºüËøôÂ∞±ÊòØÈóÆÈ¢ò„ÄÇ Êàë‰ª¨ÊúâÂæàÂ§ö‰ºòÁßÄÁöÑ Linux Ê°åÈù¢ÂèëË°åÁâàÔºå‰ΩÜËøôÊÑèÂë≥ÁùÄÂÆÉ‰ª¨‰∏≠Ê≤°Êúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™ËÉΩËé∑ÂæóË∂≥Â§üÁöÑÂ∏ÇÂú∫‰ªΩÈ¢ùÔºå‰ªéËÄåÂú® Êï¥‰∏™Â∏ÇÂú∫ ‰∏ä‰∫ßÁîü‰ªª‰ΩïÁúüÊ≠£ÁöÑÂΩ±Âìç„ÄÇ Ëá™‰ªé‰∫∫‰ª¨ÂºÄÂßãË∞àËÆ∫‰ΩïÊó∂ Linux ËÉΩÂú®Ê°åÈù¢‰∏äÂáªË¥• Windows ‰ª•Êù•ÔºåÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ÄÁõ¥Â¶ÇÊ≠§„ÄÇÂ∞ΩÁÆ°Êàë‰ª¨ÂèØËÉΩÊ¢¶ÊÉ≥ÁùÄ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁúüÊ≠£ÁöÑ Linux Ê°åÈù¢Âπ¥Âà∞Êù•Ôºå‰ΩÜÂÆÉ‰ªéÊú™Âà∞Êù•„ÄÇÊ≠£Â¶Ç Forrester È´òÁ∫ßÂàÜÊûêÂ∏à Andrew Hewitt ÊúÄËøëÊåáÂá∫ÁöÑÈÇ£Ê†∑Ôºå‚ÄúÊÄªÁöÑÊù•ËØ¥ÔºåÂè™Êúâ 1% ÁöÑÂëòÂ∑• Êä•ÂëäËØ¥‰ªñ‰ª¨Áî®‰∫éÂ∑•‰ΩúÁöÑ‰∏ªË¶ÅÁ¨îËÆ∞Êú¨ÁîµËÑë‰ΩøÁî®‰∫Ü Linux„ÄÇËÄå 60%ÁöÑ‰∫∫‰ªçÂú®‰ΩøÁî® Windows‚Ä¶‚Ä¶„ÄÇLinux ‰∏çÂ§™ÂèØËÉΩË∂ÖË∂ä Windows Êàê‰∏∫‰∏ªË¶ÅÊìç‰ΩúÁ≥ªÁªü"„ÄÇ ‰ªñÊ≤°ÊúâËØ¥Èîô„ÄÇ ËøôÂπ∂‰∏çÊòØËØ¥ Linux ‰∏çËÉΩÊàê‰∏∫‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊàêÂäüÁöÑÁªàÁ´ØÁî®Êà∑ÁéØÂ¢É„ÄÇ‰∫ãÂÆû‰∏äÔºåÂÆÉÊòØÔºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•ËØ¥ Linux ÊòØÊúÄÊàêÂäüÁöÑÁªàÁ´ØÁî®Êà∑Êìç‰ΩúÁ≥ªÁªüÔºåËÄå‰∏çÊòØ Windows„ÄÇËøôÊòØÂõ†‰∏∫Áé∞Âú®Êúâ Ë∂ÖËøá 30 ‰∫øÈÉ®ÂÆâÂçìÊâãÊú∫ÔºåËÄåÂÆâÂçìÂè™ÊòØ‚Ä¶  ( 1 min )

  • Open

    Use Terraform to manage TrueNAS
    Use Terraform to manage TrueNAS Alan Formy-Duval Mon, 06/13/2022 - 03:00 Register or Login to like Register or Login to like Sometimes combining different open source projects can have benefits. The synergy of using Terraform with TrueNAS is a perfect example. TrueNAS is an OpenBSD-based operating system that provides network-attached storage (NAS) and network services. One of its main strengths is leveraging the ZFS file system, which is known for enterprise-level reliability and fault tolerance. Terraform is a provisioning and deployment tool embodying the concept of infrastructure as code. TrueNAS TrueNAS has a very nice web user interface (UI) for its management and an application programming interface (API). Terraform can be integrated with the API to provide configuration manag‚Ä¶  ( 5 min )

    theme: juejin highlight: a11y-dark ÊåÅÁª≠Âàõ‰ΩúÔºåÂä†ÈÄüÊàêÈïøÔºÅËøôÊòØÊàëÂèÇ‰∏é„ÄåÊéòÈáëÊó•Êñ∞ËÆ°Âàí ¬∑ 6 ÊúàÊõ¥ÊñáÊåëÊàò„ÄçÁöÑÁ¨¨3Â§©ÔºåÁÇπÂáªÊü•ÁúãÊ¥ªÂä®ËØ¶ÊÉÖ Android‰∏≠Ê∂àÊÅØÊÄªÁ∫øÁöÑÂá†ÁßçÂÆûÁé∞ÊñπÂºè ÂâçË®Ä Ê∂àÊÅØÊÄªÁ∫øÂèàÂè´‰∫ã‰ª∂ÊÄªÁ∫øÔºå‰∏∫‰ªÄ‰πàÊàë‰ª¨ÈúÄË¶Å‰∏Ä‰∏™Ê∂àÊÅØÊÄªÁ∫øÂë¢ÔºüÊòØÂõ†‰∏∫ÈöèÁùÄÈ°πÁõÆÂèòÂ§ßÔºåÈ°µÈù¢ÂèòÂ§öÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÂèØËÉΩÂá∫Áé∞Ë∑®È°µÈù¢„ÄÅË∑®ÁªÑ‰ª∂„ÄÅË∑®Á∫øÁ®ã„ÄÅË∑®ËøõÁ®ã‰º†ÈÄíÊ∂àÊÅØ‰∏éÊï∞ÊçÆÔºå‰∏∫‰∫ÜÊõ¥Êñπ‰æøÁöÑÁõ¥Êé•ÈÄöÁü•Âà∞ÊåáÂÆöÁöÑÈ°µÈù¢ÂÆûÁé∞ÂÖ∑‰ΩìÁöÑÈÄªËæëÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÈúÄË¶ÅÊ∂àÊÅØÊÄªÁ∫øÊù•ÂÆûÁé∞„ÄÇ ‰ªéÊúÄÂü∫Êú¨ÁöÑ BroadcastReceiver Âà∞ EventBus ÂÜçÂà∞RxBus ,ÂêéÊù•ÂÆòÊñπÂá∫‰∫ÜAndroidX jetpack Êàë‰ª¨ÂºÄÂßã‰ΩøÁî®LiveDataBusÔºåÊúÄÂêéÂà∞KotlinÁöÑÊµÅË°åÂá∫Êù•‰∫ÜFlowBus„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨ÁúãÁúã‰ªñ‰ª¨ÊòØÊÄé‰πà‰∏ÄÊ≠•‰∏ÄÊ≠•ÊºîÂèòÁöÑ„ÄÇ ‰∏Ä„ÄÅBroadcastReceiver ÂπøÊí≠ Êàë‰ª¨ÂÜçÂàùÂÖ• Android ÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÈÉΩÂ∫îËØ•Â≠¶ËøáÂπøÊí≠Êé•Êî∂ËÄÖÔºåÂàÜ‰∏∫ÈùôÊÄÅÂπøÊí≠ÂíåÂä®ÊÄÅÊ≥®ÂÜåÂπøÊí≠ÔºåÂú®È´òÁâàÊú¨ÁöÑ Android ‰∏≠ÈôêÂà∂‰∫ÜÊàë‰ª¨‰∏Ä‰∫õÈùôÊÄÅÂπøÊí≠ÁöÑ‰ΩøÁî®Ôºå‰∏çËøáÊàë‰ª¨ËøòÊòØËÉΩÈÄöËøáÂä®ÊÄÅÊ≥®ÂÜåÁöÑÊñπÂºèËé∑Âèñ‰∏Ä‰∫õÁ≥ªÁªüÁöÑÁä∂ÊÄÅÊîπÂèò„ÄÇÂÉèÂ∏∏Áî®ÁöÑÁîµÈáèÂèòÂåñ„ÄÅÁΩëÁªúÁä∂ÊÄÅÂèòÂåñ„ÄÅÁü≠‰ø°ÂèëÈÄÅÊé•Êî∂ÁöÑÁä∂ÊÄÅÁ≠âÁ≠â„ÄÇ ÊØîÂ¶ÇÁΩëÁªúÂèòÂåñÁöÑÁõëÂê¨Ôºö IntentFilter intentFilter = new IntentFilter(ConnectivityManager.CONNECTIVITY_ACTION); application.getApplicationContext().registerReceiver(InstanceHolder.INSTANCE, intentFilter); Âú®Ê∂àÊÅØ‰∏≠Á∫ø‰∏≠ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÂèØ‰ª•‰ΩøÁî®Êú¨Âú∞ÂπøÊí≠Êù•ÂÆûÁé∞ LocalBroadcastManager Ê∂àÊÅØÁöÑÈÄöÁü•„ÄÇ LocalBroadcastManager mLocalBroadcastManager = LocalBroa‚Ä¶
    „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - ÊãæÊçå„ÄëÊûÑ‰ª∂ÁâπÊïà | ComponentEffect ‰∏ÄÊóè
    theme: cyanosis ÊåÅÁª≠Âàõ‰ΩúÔºåÂä†ÈÄüÊàêÈïøÔºÅËøôÊòØÊàëÂèÇ‰∏é„ÄåÊéòÈáëÊó•Êñ∞ËÆ°Âàí ¬∑ 6 ÊúàÊõ¥ÊñáÊåëÊàò„ÄçÁöÑÁ¨¨ 19 Â§©ÔºåÁÇπÂáªÊü•ÁúãÊ¥ªÂä®ËØ¶ÊÉÖ ÂâçË®Ä ËøôÊòØ‰∏ÄÂ•ó Âº†È£éÊç∑ÁâπÁÉà Âá∫ÂìÅÁöÑ Flutter&Flame Á≥ªÂàóÊïôÁ®ãÔºåÂèëÂ∏É‰∫éÊéòÈáëÁ§æÂå∫„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†Âú®ÂÖ∂‰ªñÂπ≥Âè∞ÁúãÂà∞Êú¨ÊñáÔºåÂèØ‰ª•Ê†πÊçÆÂØπ‰∫éÈìæÊé•ÁßªÊ≠•Âà∞ÊéòÈáë‰∏≠Êü•Áúã„ÄÇÂõ†‰∏∫ÊñáÁ´†ÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÊõ¥Êñ∞„ÄÅ‰øÆÊ≠£Ôºå‰∏ÄÂàá‰ª•ÊéòÈáëÊñáÁ´†ÁâàÊú¨‰∏∫ÂáÜ„ÄÇÊú¨Á≥ªÂàóÊ∫êÁ†Å‰∫é „Äêtoly_game„Äë ÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÊú¨Á≥ªÂàóÂØπ‰Ω†ÊúâÊâÄÂ∏ÆÂä©ÔºåÂ∏åÊúõÁÇπËµûÊîØÊåÅÔºåÊú¨Á≥ªÂàóÊñáÁ´†‰∏ÄËßàÔºö „ÄêFlutter&Flame Ê∏∏Êàè - Â£π„ÄëÂºÄÂêØÊñ∞‰∏ñÁïåÁöÑÂ§ßÈó® „ÄêFlutter&Flame Ê∏∏Êàè - Ë¥∞„ÄëÊìçÁ∫µÊùÜ‰∏éËßíËâ≤ÁßªÂä® „ÄêFlutter&Flame Ê∏∏Êàè - ÂèÅ„ÄëÈîÆÁõò‰∫ã‰ª∂‰∏éÊâãÂäøÊìç‰Ωú „ÄêFlutter&Flame Ê∏∏Êàè - ËÇÜ„ÄëÁ≤æÁÅµÂõæÁâáÂä†ËΩΩÊñπÂºè „ÄêFlutter&Flame Ê∏∏Êàè - ‰ºç„ÄëCanvas ÂèÇ‰∏ä | ËßíËâ≤ÁöÑË°ÄÊù° „ÄêFlutter&Flame Ê∏∏Êàè - ÈôÜ„ÄëÊö¥Âáª Dash | ÊñáÂ≠óÊûÑ‰ª∂ÁöÑ‰ΩøÁî® „ÄêFlutter&Flame Ê∏∏Êàè - Êüí„Äë‰∫∫ÈöèÊåáÂä® | Âä®ÁîªÁÇπËß¶‰∏éÁßªÂä® „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - Êçå„ÄëË£ÖÂºπÂÆåÊØï | ËßíËâ≤Ê≠¶Âô®ÂèëÂ∞Ñ „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - Áéñ„ÄëÊé¢Á¥¢ÊûÑ‰ª∂ | Component ÊòØ‰ªÄ‰πà „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - Êãæ„ÄëÊé¢Á¥¢ÊûÑ‰ª∂ | Component ÁîüÂëΩÂë®ÊúüÂõûË∞É „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - ÊãæÂ£π„ÄëÊé¢Á¥¢ÊûÑ‰ª∂ | Component ‰ΩøÁî®ÁªÜËäÇ „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - ÊãæË¥∞„ÄëÊé¢Á¥¢ÊûÑ‰ª∂ | ËßíËâ≤ÁÆ°ÁêÜ „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - ÊãæÂèÅ„ÄëÁ¢∞ÊíûÊ£ÄÊµã | CollisionCallbacks „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - ÊãæËÇÜ„ÄëÁ¢∞ÊíûÊ£ÄÊµã | ‰πãÂâç‰ª£Á†Å‰ºòÂåñ „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - Êãæ‰ºç„ÄëÁ≤íÂ≠êÁ≥ªÁªü | ParticleSystemComponent „ÄêF‚Ä¶
    ASM ÊèíÊ°©ÈááÈõÜÊñπÊ≥ïÂÖ•ÂèÇÔºåÂá∫ÂèÇÂèäËÄóÊó∂‰ø°ÊÅØ
    theme: smartblue highlight: a11y-dark ÂâçË®Ä ASMÂ≠óËäÇÁ†ÅÊèíÊ°©ÊäÄÊúØÂú®AndroidÂºÄÂèë‰∏≠ÊúâÁùÄÂπøÊ≥õÁöÑÂ∫îÁî®Ôºå‰ΩÜÁõ∏‰ø°ÂæàÂ§ö‰∫∫‰ºö‰∏çÁü•ÈÅìÊÄé‰πà‰∏äÊâãÔºå‰∏çÁü•ÈÅìËØ•ÊãøASMÊù•ÂÅöÁÇπ‰ªÄ‰πà„ÄÇ Â≠¶‰π†‰∏ÄÈó®ÊäÄÊúØÊúÄÂ•ΩÁöÑÊñπÊ≥ïÂ∞±ÊòØÂä®ÊâãÂÆûË∑µÔºåÊú¨Êñá‰∏ªË¶ÅÈÄöËøáASMÊèíÊ°©ÈááÈõÜÊñπÊ≥ïÁöÑÂÖ•ÂèÇÔºåÂá∫ÂèÇÂèäËÄóÊó∂‰ø°ÊÅØÂπ∂ÊâìÂç∞ÔºåÈÄöËøá‰∏Ä‰∏™‰∏çÂ§ß‰∏çÂ∞èÁöÑ‰æãÂ≠êÂø´ÈÄü‰∏äÊâãASMÊèíÊ°©ÂºÄÂèë„ÄÇ ÊäÄÊúØÁõÆÊ†á Êàë‰ª¨ÂÖàÁúã‰∏ãÊúÄÁªàÁöÑÊïàÊûú ÊèíÊ°©Ââç‰ª£Á†Å È¶ñÂÖàÊù•Áúã‰∏ãÊèíÊ°©Ââç‰ª£Á†ÅÔºåÂ∞±ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™sumÊñπÊ≥ï private fun sum(i: Int, j: Int): Int { return i + j } ÊèíÊ°©Âêé‰ª£Á†Å Êé•‰∏ãÊù•Áúã‰∏ãÊèíÊ°©ÂêéÁöÑ‰ª£Á†Å private final int sum(int i, int j) { ArrayList arrayList = new ArrayList(); arrayList.add(Integer.valueOf(i)); arrayList.add(Integer.valueOf(j)); MethodRecorder.onMethodEnter("com.zj.android_asm.MainActivity", "sum", arrayList); int i2 = i + j; MethodRecorder.onMethodExit(Integer.valueOf(i2), "com.zj.android_asm.MainActivity", "sum", "I,I", "I"); return i2; } ÂèØ‰ª•ÁúãÂá∫ÔºåÊñπÊ≥ïÊâÄÊúâÂèÇÊï∞ÈÉΩË¢´Ê∑ªÂä†Âà∞‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™arrayList‰∏≠ÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îË∞ÉÁî®‰∫ÜMethodRecorder.onMethodEnterÊñπÊ≥ï Me‚Ä¶

    theme: github highlight: arduino-light ËøôÊòØ MVI Êû∂ÊûÑÁöÑÁ¨¨‰∏âÁØáÔºåÁ≥ªÂàóÊñáÁ´†ÁõÆÂΩïÂ¶Ç‰∏ãÔºö Android Êû∂ÊûÑ‰πã MVI ÈõèÂΩ¢ | ÂìçÂ∫îÂºèÁºñÁ®ã + ÂçïÂêëÊï∞ÊçÆÊµÅ + ÂîØ‰∏ÄÂèØ‰ø°Êï∞ÊçÆÊ∫ê Android Êû∂ÊûÑ‰πã MVI ÂàùÁ∫ß‰Ωì | Flow ÊõøÊç¢ LiveData ÈáçÊûÑÊï∞ÊçÆÈìæË∑Ø Android Êû∂ÊûÑ‰πã MVI ÂÆåÂÖ®‰Ωì | ÈáçÊñ∞ÂÆ°ËßÜ MVVM ‰πãÊÆáÔºàPartialChange & ReducerÔºâ ÂÖ∂‰∏≠Á¨¨‰∏ÄÁØáÂâñÊûê‰∫Ü MVI ÁöÑÊ¶ÇÂøµÔºåÁ¨¨‰∫åÁØáÊòØ MVI Âú®È°πÁõÆÂÆûÊàò‰∏≠ÁöÑÂàùÁ∫ßÂ∫îÁî®ÔºåËÄåËøô‰∏ÄÁØáÂ∞ÜÈáçÊûÑ‰∏äÁØáÁöÑ‰ª£Á†ÅÔºå‰ª•Â±ïÁ§∫ MVI ÁöÑÂÆåÂÖ®‰Ωì„ÄÇ ÂºïÂ≠ê Âú®‰∏ä‰∏ÄÁØá‰∏≠ÔºåÁî® MVI ÈáçÊûÑ‰∫Ü‚ÄúÊñ∞ÈóªÊµÅ‚ÄùËøô‰∏™‰∏öÂä°Âú∫ÊôØ„ÄÇÊú¨ÁØáÂú®Ê≠§Âü∫Á°Ä‰∏äËøõ‰∏ÄÊ≠•ÊãìÂ±ïÔºåÂºïÂÖ• MVI ‰∏≠‰∏§‰∏™ÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑÊ¶ÇÂøµPartialChangeÂíåReducer„ÄÇ ÂÅáËÆæ‚ÄúÊñ∞ÈóªÊµÅ‚ÄùËøô‰∏™‰∏öÂä°Âú∫ÊôØÔºåÁî®Êà∑ÂèØ‰ª•Ëß¶ÂèëÂ¶Ç‰∏ãË°å‰∏∫Ôºö ÂàùÂßãÂåñÊñ∞ÈóªÊµÅ ‰∏äÊãâÂä†ËΩΩÊõ¥Â§öÊñ∞Èóª ‰∏æÊä•ÊüêÊù°Êñ∞Èóª Âú® MVVM ‰∏≠ÔºåËøô‰∫õË°å‰∏∫Ë¢´Ë°®Ëææ‰∏∫ ViewModel ÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊñπÊ≥ïË∞ÉÁî®„ÄÇÂú® MVI ‰∏≠Ë¢´Áß∞‰∏∫ÊÑèÂõæIntentÔºåÂÆÉ‰ª¨‰∏çÂÜçÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊñπÊ≥ïË∞ÉÁî®ÔºåËÄåÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Êï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÇÈÄöÂ∏∏ÂèØË¢´ËøôÊ†∑ÂÆö‰πâÔºö sealed class FeedsIntent { data class Init(val type: Int, val count: Int) : FeedsIntent() data class More(val timestamp: Long, val count: Int) : FeedsIntent() data class Report(val id: Long) : FeedsIntent() } ËøôÊ†∑ÂÅö‰ΩøÂæóÁïåÈù¢ÊÑèÂõæÈÉΩ‰ª•Êï∞ÊçÆÁöÑÂΩ¢ÂºèÊµÅÂÖ•Âà∞‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊµÅ‰∏≠ÔºåÂ•ΩÂ§ÑÊòØÔºåÂèØ‰ª•Áî®ÊµÅÁöÑÊñπÂºèÁªü‰∏ÄÁÆ°ÁêÜÊâÄÊúâÊÑèÂõæ„ÄÇÊõ¥ËØ¶ÁªÜÁöÑËÆ≤Ëß£ÂèØ‰ª•ÁÇπÂáªAndroid Êû∂ÊûÑ‰πã MVI | ÂìçÂ∫îÂºèÁºñÁ®ã + ÂçïÂêëÊï∞ÊçÆÊµÅ‚Ä¶
    Flutter Â∞èÊäÄÂ∑ß‰πãÁé©ËΩ¨Â≠ó‰ΩìÊ∏≤ÊüìÂíåÈóÆÈ¢ò‰øÆÂ§ç
    theme: smartblue ËøôÊ¨°ÁöÑ Flutter Â∞èÊäÄÂ∑ßÊòØÂ≠ó‰ΩìÊ∏≤ÊüìÔºåËôΩÁÑ∂ÊòØÂ∞èÊäÄÂ∑ß‰ΩÜÊòØÂÜÖÂÆπÁï•ÈïøÔºåÂèØËÉΩÂ§ßÂÆ∂Âú®Êó•Â∏∏ÂºÄÂèë‰∏≠‰∏ç‰ºöÁâπÂà´ÂÖ≥ÂøÉÂ≠ó‰ΩìÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑÈÉ®ÂàÜÔºåËÄåËøôÂ∞ÜÊòØ‰∏ÄÁØá‰Ω†Âπ≥Êó∂ÂèØËÉΩÁî®‰∏çÂà∞ Ôºå‰ΩÜÊòØÈÅáÂà∞ÈóÆÈ¢òÂ∞±‰ºöÁøªÂá∫Êù•ÁöÑÊñáÁ´†„ÄÇ Êú¨ÁØáÂ∞ÜÂø´ÈÄüÊôÆÂèä‰∏Ä‰∫õÂ≠ó‰ΩìÊ∏≤ÊüìÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑÂü∫Á°ÄÔºåËß£ÂÜ≥‰∏Ä‰∫õÂõ†‰∏∫Â≠ó‰ΩìËÄåÂØºËá¥ÁöÑÂºÇÂ∏∏ÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÂπ∂Á©øÊèí‰∏Ä‰∫õÂÆûÁî®Â∞èÊäÄÂ∑ßÔºåÂÜÖÂÆπÁØáÂπÖÂèØËÉΩÁï•ÈïøÔºåÂª∫ËÆÆÂÖà Mark ÂêéÁúã„ÄÇ ‰∏Ä„ÄÅÂ≠ó‰ΩìÂ∫ì È¶ñÂÖàÔºåÈóÆ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊàëÁªèÂ∏∏ÈóÆÁöÑÈù¢ËØïÈ¢òÔºöFlutter Âú® Android Âíå iOS ‰∏ä‰ΩøÁî®‰∫ÜÂì™‰∫õÂ≠ó‰ΩìÔºü Â¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†ÊÅ∞Â•ΩÁúãËøá typography.dart ÁöÑÊ∫êÁ†ÅÂíåËß£ÈáäÔºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•‰ºöÊúâÂàùÊ≠•ÁªìËÆ∫Ôºö Android ‰∏ä‰ΩøÁî®ÁöÑÊòØ Roboto Â≠ó‰ΩìÔºõ iOS ‰∏ä‰ΩøÁî®ÁöÑÊòØ .SF UI Display ÊàñËÄÖ .SF UI Text Â≠ó‰ΩìÔºõ ‰ΩÜÊòØÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†ÂÜçËøõ‰∏ÄÊ≠•Âéª‰∫ÜËß£Â∞±‰ºöÂèëÁé∞ÔºåÂú®Âä†‰∏ä‰∏≠ÊñáÊòæÁ§∫‰πãÂêéÔºåÁªìËÆ∫Â∫îËØ•ÊòØÔºö ÈªòËÆ§Âú® iOS ‰∏äÔºö ‰∏≠ÊñáÂ≠ó‰ΩìÔºöPingFang SC (ÁπÅ‰ΩìËøòÊúâ PingFang TC „ÄÅ PingFang HK ) Ëã±ÊñáÂ≠ó‰ΩìÔºö.SF UI Text / .SF UI Display ÈªòËÆ§Âú® Android ‰∏äÔºö ‰∏≠ÊñáÂ≠ó‰ΩìÔºöSource Han Sans / Noto Ëã±ÊñáÂ≠ó‰ΩìÔºöRoboto ÈÇ£ËøôÊó∂ÂÄô‰Ω†ÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÈóÆÔºö.SF Ê≤°Êúâ‰∏≠ÊñáÔºåÈÇ£ÂèØ‰ª•‰ΩøÁî® PingFang ÊòæÁ§∫Ëã±ÊñáÂêóÔºü Á≠îÊ°àÊòØÂèØ‰ª•ÁöÑÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÂ≠óÂΩ¢ÂíåÂ≠óÈáç‰ºöÊúâÂæÆÂ¶ôÂå∫Âà´Ôºå ‰æãÂ¶Ç‰∏ãÂõæÈáåÁöÑ G Â∞±ÊúâÂæàÊòéÊòæÁöÑ‰∏çÂêå„ÄÇ ÈÇ£Â¶ÇÊûúÂä†‰∏äÈü©ÊñáÂë¢ÔºüËøôÊó∂ÂÄô iOS ‰∏äÁöÑ PingFang Âíå .SF Â∞±‰∏çÂ§üÁî®‰∫ÜÔºåÈúÄË¶ÅË∞ÉÁî®Â¶Ç Apple SD Gothic Neo ËøôÊ†∑ÁöÑË∂ÖÈõÜÂ≠ó‰ΩìÂ∫ìÔºåËÄåËØ¥Âà∞ËøôÈáåÂ∞±ÈúÄË¶Å‰ªãÁªç‰∏Ä‰∏™ Flutter ‰∏ä‰Ω†ÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÈÅáÂà∞ÁöÑ Bug„ÄÇ Â¶Ç‰∏ãÂõæÊâÄÁ§∫ÔºåÂΩìÂú®‰ΩøÁî® Apple SD Gothic Neo Â≠ó‰ΩìÂá∫Áé∞‰∏≠ÊñáÂíåÈü©ÊñáÂêåÊó∂ÊòæÁ§∫Êó∂Ôºå‰Ω†ÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÂØüËßâ‰∏Ä‰∫õÂ≠óÂΩ¢ÂæàÂ•áÊÄ™ÔºåÊØîÂ¶Ç„ÄêÊé®‚Ä¶
    Jetpack Compose ÂÆûÁé∞‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂõæÁâáÈÄâÊã©Ê°ÜÊû∂
    theme: hydrogen highlight: androidstudio ÂÖ¨‰ºóÂè∑ÔºöÂ≠óËäÇÊï∞ÁªÑ Â∏åÊúõÂØπ‰Ω†ÊúâÊâÄÂ∏ÆÂä© ü§£ü§£ Áü•‰πéÁöÑ Matisse Â∫îËØ•ËõÆÂ§ö Android ÂºÄÂèëËÄÖÊúâ‰∫ÜËß£ËøáÊàñËÄÖÊòØÊõæÁªè‰ΩøÁî®ËøáÔºåËøôÊòØÁü•‰πéÂú® 2017 Âπ¥ÂºÄÊ∫êÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∏™ Android Á´ØÂõæÁâáÈÄâÊã©Ê°ÜÊû∂ÔºåÂÖ∂È¢úÂÄºÂú®Áé∞Âú®ÁúãÊù•‰πüËøòÊòØÊå∫‰∏çÈîôÁöÑ ÂèØÊÉúËøëÂá†Âπ¥Áü•‰πéÂÆòÊñπÂ∑≤Áªè‰∏çÂÜçÂØπ Matisse ËøõË°åÁª¥Êä§Êõ¥Êñ∞‰∫ÜÔºå‰∏ä‰∏ÄÊ¨°Êèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩïËøòÂÅúÁïôÂú® 2019 Âπ¥ÔºåÁ¥ØÁßØ‰∫Ü 400 ‰∏™ issues ‰∏ÄÁõ¥Ê≤°‰∫∫Ëß£Á≠îÔºåÂæàÂ§öÈ´òÁâàÊú¨Á≥ªÁªüÁöÑÂÖºÂÆπÊÄßÈóÆÈ¢òÂíåÂÜÖÈÉ® bug ‰πü‰∏ÄÁõ¥Âæó‰∏çÂà∞Ëß£ÂÜ≥„ÄÇÊàëÂèçÁºñËØë‰∫ÜÁü•‰πéÁöÑ AppÔºåÂèëÁé∞ÂÖ∂ÂÜÖÈÉ®Ëøò‰øùÁïôÁùÄ Matisse ÁöÑÁõ∏ÂÖ≥‰ª£Á†ÅÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•Áü•‰πéÂ∫îËØ•‰∏çÊòØÂÆåÂÖ®Â∫üÂºÉ‰∫Ü MatisseÔºåËÄåÂè™ÊòØ‰∏çÂÜçÂºÄÊ∫ê‰∫Ü ÊàëÂÖ¨Âè∏ÁöÑÈ°πÁõÆ‰πü‰ΩøÁî®Âà∞‰∫Ü MatisseÔºåÈöèÁùÄ Android Á≥ªÁªüÁöÑÊõ¥Êñ∞ÔºåÊó∂‰∏çÊó∂Âú∞Â∞±‰ºöÊúâÁî®Êà∑Êù•ÂèçÈ¶àÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÊó†Â•àÊàë‰πüÂè™ËÉΩ fork ‰∫ÜÊ∫êÁ†ÅËá™Â∑±Êù•Áª¥Êä§„ÄÇ‰∏ÄÁõ¥Ëøô‰πàÂ∞è‰øÆÂ∞èË°•ÁªàÁ©∂‰∏çÂ§™ÂêàÈÄÇÔºåËÄå‰∏îÂ¶ÇÊûú‰∏çËøõË°åÂÆåÂÖ®ÈáçÂÜôÁöÑËØùÔºåMatisse ÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∫õ‰∫§‰∫í‰ΩìÈ™åÈóÆÈ¢ò‰πüÊ≤°Ê≥ïÂæóÂà∞ÂΩªÂ∫ïËß£ÂÜ≥ÔºåËÄåËøô‰∫õÈóÆÈ¢òÂú®Áü•‰πéÁõÆÂâçÁöÑÂÆòÊñπ App ‰∏ä‰πü‰∏ÄÊ†∑Â≠òÂú®Ôºå‰ª•‰øÆÊîπ‰∏™‰∫∫Â§¥ÂÉèÊó∂ÊâìÂºÄÁöÑÂõæÁâáÈÄâÊã©È°µÈù¢‰∏∫‰æãÔºö ÊàëÂèëÁé∞ÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢òÊúâ‰∏â‰∏™Ôºö Áü•‰πéÁöÑÁî®Êà∑Â§¥ÂÉè‰∏çÊîØÊåÅ Gif Ê†ºÂºèÔºåÂΩìÁî®Êà∑ÁÇπÂáª Gif ÂõæÁâáÊó∂‰ºöÊèêÁ§∫ ‚Äú‰∏çÊîØÊåÅÁöÑÊñá‰ª∂Á±ªÂûã‚Äù„ÄÇÊåâÊàëÁöÑÊÉ≥Ê≥ïÔºåÊó¢ÁÑ∂‰∏çÊîØÊåÅ Gif Ê†ºÂºèÔºåÈÇ£‰πà‰∏ÄÂºÄÂßãÂ±ïÁ§∫ÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÂ∞±Â∫îËØ•ËøáÊª§ÊéâÊâçÂØπÔºåËÄåÁü•‰πéÁõÆÂâçÁöÑÁ≠õÈÄâÈÄªËæëÂ∫îËØ•Â∞±ÊòØÊù•Ê∫êËá™ Matisse ÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫ Matisse ‰πü‰∏çÊîØÊåÅ Âè™Â±ïÁ§∫ÈùôÊÄÅÂõæÔºå‰ΩÜÂèàÂèØ‰ª• Âè™Â±ïÁ§∫ GifÔºåËøôÁ≠õÈÄâÈÄªËæëÊàëËßâÂæóÂçÅÂàÜÂ•áÊÄ™ ÂΩìÂèñÊ∂àÂãæÈÄâÈùôÊÄÅÂõæÊó∂ÔºåÂèØ‰ª•ÁúãÂà∞ Gif ÂõæÁâá‰ºöÂæàÊòéÊòæÂú∞Èó™ÁÉÅ‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏ãÔºåÊ≠§ÈóÆÈ¢òÂú® Matisse ‰∏≠‰πüÂ≠òÂú®„ÄÇËÄåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰ªéÁü•‰πéÁöÑÁºñËæëÂô®ËøõÂÖ•ÂõæÁâáÈÄâÊã©È°µÈù¢ÁöÑËØùÔºåÂ∞±‰∏çÂçïÂçïÊòØ Gif ÂõæÁâá‰ºöÈó™ÁÉÅ‰∫ÜÔºåËÄåÊòØÊï¥‰∏™È°µÈù¢ÈÉΩ‰ºöÈó™ÁÉÅ‰∏Ä‰∏ã‚Ä¶ ÂΩìÁÇπÂáª‰∏ãÊãâËèúÂçïÊó∂ÔºåÂèØ‰ª•ÁúãÂà∞ Pictures ‚Ä¶

    Astra‚Äôs failed launch resulted in the loss of two NASA weather satellites
    A rocket belonging to the up-and-coming Astra space company failed to deliver two of NASA‚Äôs weather-tracking satellites to space after its second stage engine shut down prematurely. Both satellites were lost as a result of the failure. Astra‚Äôs Launch Vehicle 0010 (LV0010) successfully took off from Florida‚Äôs Cape Canaveral Space Force Station at 1:43PM ET, but suffered an upper stage failure about 10 minutes into its flight. The launch was part of NASA‚Äôs mission to send six TROPICS satellites into space ‚Äî these small, foot-long CubeSats are supposed to help NASA keep better track of developing tropical storms. CubeSats are low-cost satellites frequently built by researchers at colleges and universities. We had a nominal first stage... Continue reading‚Ä¶  ( 2 min )
    Watch 15 minutes of Starfield gameplay
    After an early glimpse of Starfield at Microsoft‚Äôs Xbox & Bethesda showcase last year and a delay to 2023, we‚Äôre now getting a much closer look at Bethesda‚Äôs first new IP in 25 years thanks to 15 minutes of gameplay. Starfield is, naturally, set in space where players will take on the role of a last group of explorers. Described as ‚ÄúSkyrim in space,‚Äù by game director Todd Howard, the RPG will be playable in both first- and third-person, but primarily it‚Äôs first-person. During the early stages of the gameplay, we arrive on the moon of Kreet, just one of more than 1,000 planets that players will be able to fly to and explore freely. Powered by Bethesda‚Äôs new Creation Engine 2, the first Starfield gameplay shows a player freely roaming... Continue reading‚Ä¶  ( 3 min )
    The biggest trailers and announcements from the 2022 Xbox & Bethesda Games Showcase
    Xbox revealed a ton of exciting news at the Xbox & Bethesda Game Showcase, ranging from a longer look at Starfield to news about Overwatch 2 and Diablo IV. For this event, Xbox only focused on games available to play within the next 12 months. So at least you won‚Äôt have to wait too long. In case you missed it, here‚Äôs a roundup of the biggest announcements and trailers. Hollow Knight: Silksong is poised to arrive within the year Hollow Knight: Silk Song, the highly-anticipated sequel to the popular Hollow Knight indie title, is set to launch on day one for Xbox Game Pass subscribers. The trailer shows off the platformer‚Äôs beautiful artwork and gameplay, but there isn‚Äôt an official release date just yet. Overwatch 2 will be free to play ... Continue reading‚Ä¶  ( 4 min )

    Three Persona titles are coming to Xbox, starting with Persona 5 Royal
    Joker and his friends from Persona 5. | Image: Sega Three beloved JRPGs in the Persona franchise ‚Äî Persona 3 Portable, Persona 4 Golden, Persona 5 Royal ‚Äî are coming to Xbox and PC, Microsoft announced at its Xbox and Bethesda Games Showcase 2022. The first will be Persona 5 Royal, which will be available on October 21st. Currently, that game is only available on PlayStation platforms, so the upcoming Xbox and PC release marks a notable expansion for the game. If you haven‚Äôt played it before, I cannot recommend the game enough ‚Äî it absolutely oozes style, and by the end of the game, you‚Äôll really feel like you connect with the many characters you meet. Person 3 Portable originally appeared on the PSP back in 2006. Persona 4 Golden was a port of Persona 4 that originally appeared on the PS... Continue reading‚Ä¶  ( 2 min )
    Diablo IV will bring the blood waves in 2023
    Image: Activision Blizzard Diablo IV, the next major release in Activision Blizzard‚Äôs popular dungeon-crawling series, will be available in 2023, the company announced Sunday. When it launches, it‚Äôll be available on PC, Xbox Series X / S, Xbox One, PS5, and PS4, and the game will have crossplay and cross-progression across all platforms. And as with previous Diablo games there will be blood ‚Äî a lot of it. Whole actual waves of blood. In addition to previously announced classes like the sorceress, barbarian, druid, and rogue, Activision Blizzard revealed the fifth playable class: Necromancer. ‚ÄúFight with aggressive skeleton Warriors, fast-attacking Skirmishers, sword and board Defenders, or scythe-wielding Reapers,‚Äù the company said in a press release. ‚ÄúUnleash a...     Overwatch 2 will be free to play and has an early access release date
    Image: Activision Blizzard Overwatch 2 will be launching ‚Äúin early access‚Äù on October 4th, Activision Blizzard announced Sunday. At least the PVP parts of it will be. And in a major change, it will be free to play ‚Äî the original Overwatch was a paid title. It will be releasing on PC, Xbox Series X / S, Xbox One, PS5, PS4, and Nintendo Switch. ‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt wait to roll out the beginning of the Overwatch 2 experience on October 4 and introduce an exciting new competitive vision, featuring amazing new content and a reimagining of the iconic heroes, maps, and gameplay that made the original game so compelling,‚Äù Mike Ybarra, president of Blizzard, said in a press release. ‚ÄúThis is the beginning of an always-on and always-evolving era for the franchise, and a recommitment...     Hollow Knight: Silksong is coming to Xbox, and it will be out within the next year
    Image: Microsoft Hollow Knight: Silksong, the sequel to the 2017 indie side-scrolling action platformer Hollow Knight, is coming to Xbox, Microsoft announced during the Xbox and Bethesda Showcase on Sunday. It will be available on Xbox Game Pass the day it‚Äôs released. While there‚Äôs no official release date, Xbox exec Sarah Bond said during the showcase that all of the games shown during the event will be available in the next 12 months. The official Xbox Twitter account confirmed that timeline, so we at least have a window of time for when we can expect the game.     9 Beautiful Cool Text Effects using Google font Effectsüëå
    Looking to style your headers or text in a more decorative way? Then you are in right place. We all use google fonts in our daily projects but did you ever notice google font is more than just that. Google fonts provide a font effect feature that is less popular & can help you in generating stylish text for your projects. Are you, excited gang? How to use this feature? effect= to your Google Fonts API request and add the corresponding class name to the HTML element(s) that you want to affect. In our example above, we used the shadow-multiple font effect, so the request would look like this: https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Rancho&effect=shadow-multiple font-effect-shadow-multiple: This is a font effect! |). https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Rancho&effect=shadow-multiple|3d-float üëáHere is a list of some of the effects that API offers - Note:- Google font API offers 25+ effects but Some of the font effects (e.g. 3d) do not scale particularly well, and tend to look best when used with larger font sizes. Read more about the feature in the docs here. Thanks for reading!  ( 2 min )
    Retrieving latest asset prices in your React dApp
    What if you need to show in your app today's BTC/USD price? Or convert the user's balance from ETH to BTC? Or are you building an Elon Musk fan site and want to provide the latest Tesla (TSLA) stock price updates? Chainlink to retrieve the latest assets prices in a single call and provide it to your app components using React Context The easiest and quickest way to do that is to use the data feed provided by Chainlink. We will use the ETH/USD pair as an example. First, we need to find the contract's address for our pair to call to. There is a handy address's list for every pair supported by Chainlink. 0x5f4eC3Df9cbd43714FE2740f5E3616155c5b8419. ABI. We will use Ethers.js library to help us with it (you could also use Web3.js, it doesn't matter here). // getLatestPrice.ts import { providers‚Ä¶  ( 4 min )
    15 Beautiful Color Gradients using CSS
    üëã, I am here with another list. In this post I have enlisted 15 aesthetic color gradients using CSS (examples of colour gradients in CSS) which you can implement in your next projects. I have used linear-gradient method of CSS and only the gradient direction 'to bottom left'. There are many others gradient directions like 'to right', 'to top' etc. to read about the linear-gradient method you can refer to this freecodecamp article. Let's jump into the list: background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #FF512F, #DD2476); background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #FF61D2, #FE9090); 3. background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #72FFB6, #10D164); background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #FD8451, #FFBD6F); background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #305170, #6DFC6B); background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #00C0FF, #4218B8); background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #009245, #FCEE21); background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #FDFCFB, #E2D1C3); background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #0100EC, #FB36F4); background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #FDABDD, #374A5A); background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #38A2D7, #561139); background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #121C84, #8278DA); background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #5761B2, #1FC5A8); background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #FFDB01, #0E197D); background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #FF3E9D, #0E1F40); Congratulations!! You have successfully read this long list. I have also tweeted this one, you can bookmark it there for your future reference. I have gathered this colourful ideas from Pinterest.     Warp your head around this terminal
    Regarding Terminals, our developers are susceptible. We love our terminal as it's our home base. So whenever a new terminal pops up, I have to try it at least. I love and use iTerm2 for almost everything. But Warp is the new kid on the block, and although it comes with some downsides, it's pretty slick! Try our Warp here This new terminal is made from scratch, not based on what we already know about terminals. This, to me, is what makes it so cool. The whole terminal experience changes and makes it feel like a native app. It's super quick to autocomplete and separate commands, so it's easy to understand which output belongs to which command. Besides these apparent wins, it's also super fast and comes with Intellisense for npm and git. You'll never forget a command this way. To be honest, there are always downsides, aren't there. It's only available for Mac, but the team seems to be working hard on a Windows and Linux version. It's not open source, this might not be a bad hard point, but for some people, that's a deal-breaker. You need to log in, which seems weird to use a terminal. I hope they are not using this personal data to keep track of our terminal usage, as it's now connected to a user profile. Worth a try if you're on Mac. It's pretty awesome to use. Try our Warp here Thank you for reading my blog. Feel free to subscribe to my email newsletter and connect on Facebook or Twitter  ( 4 min )

    All Online Tools in ‚ÄúOne Box‚Äù
    What? 10015.io is an online tool factory where you can get all tools you needed in one place. While serving different type of tools in different categories, it aims to perform this with a clean and beautiful user interface. Every tool is designed to solve a problem with minimum number of steps to save time of the users and decrease the complexity of the operation. 10015.io has started to operate in 2020 and it will continue to grow with time by adding new tools each day. Tool Categories Text Tools Image Tools CSS Tools Coding Tools Color Tools Social Media Tools Miscellaneous Tools Get the extension and access all tools with just one click Add to Chrome Add to Firefox There are lots of sites on web which offers you online tools. Most of them focus on specific topics and they mostly have outdated designs which makes you think "Am I in 90's?". When you start to bookmark the tools you needed, the list becomes larger and larger in some point. 10015 Tools solves all these problems. So, bookmark it and forget about all other tool sites. 10015.io is designed and coded by Fatih Telis (me) as a side project. I am a frontend developer based in Istanbul, Turkey. I started this project to build a platform which will work as an all-in-one toolbox while I'm challenging myself to create tools which does many different things. Even though I'm not a professional designer, I'm doing my best to construct a simple, aesthetic and easy-to-use UI system.     How to think like a programmer
    What is HTML All The Things? HTML All The Things is a web development podcast and discord community which was started by Matt and Mike, developers based in Ontario, Canada. The podcast speaks to web development topics as well as running a small business, self-employment and time management. You can join them for both their successes and their struggles as they try to manage expanding their Web Development business without stretching themselves too thin. This week, Matt and Mike discussed how to think like a programmer. When you're learning to code you may think that syntax is the most important thing since it is so hard to memorize. The problem with memorizing syntax is that if you ever need to move on to a new programming language, you'll have to start memorizing all over again. Instea‚Ä¶  ( 5 min )
    A Cool Way To Learn JavaScript
    Hello World ! S Soumyakanta. It's important to learn things in a structured way. After all I found Free Code Camp on web and Youtube. As a beginner I was making the same mistake again and again. But from the Free Code Camp's Youtube channel I found Per Harald Borgen's free beginner level full Javascript course. It was a interactive course on Scrimba.com. It was important for me to practice online to boost my journey. I know you may ask their are many online code learning platform's then why Scrimba !!! then here are some answers why as newbie should learn JS from Scimba's Learn JavaScript for free ! 1. If you haven't a high end device:- For this course you only need a PC(1 GB Ram),Internet and a browser(Chrome suggested). Your journey will not stop due to lack of resources. You don't need to run several application to start. 2.If you're a beginner:-I struggled hard to learn code by self ,in the way to my web development journey. I love to learn things by doing practical application in real world. This course will teach you Javascript by creating three projects like Passenger counter app, Blackjack game and a chrome extension. 3.Fun and Zero distraction:- While learning from Youtube as a newbie I was so distracted by other recommended videos. In this course it was simple for me to stay focused. This course is amazingly delivered by Mr. Per . You will learn several things by doing challenges in this course. My Suggestion to beginners:-After searching several platform's I would suggest to learn Javascript from Scrimba. Don't waste so much time on watching random videos one after one to learn. It's a 7 hour long video and I assure you that you're going to enjoy it. For Mr. Per:- Hello sir ! thanks for your teaching. Your course impacted my life. It's my humble gratitude to you. Thanks a lot. I hope this review will help you to start journey in a productive way. If you are reading this I will happy that we will stay connected. Here is my social media links below !     50+ hints JS(ES6+) developer must know (10th part)
    My thanks to everybody who follows to this tenth, the last blog of JS hint. 1. Accessors Do not use JavaScript getters/setters as they cause unexpected side effects and are harder to test, maintain, and reason about. Instead, if you do make accessor functions, use getVal() and setVal('hello'). // bad class Dragon { get age() { // ... } set age(value) { // ... } } // good class Dragon { getAge() { // ... } setAge(value) { // ... } } If the property/method is a boolean, use isVal() or hasVal(). // bad if (!dragon.age()) { return false; } // good if (!dragon.hasAge()) { return false; } It‚Äôs okay to create get() and set() functions, but be consistent. class Jedi { constructor(options = {}) { const lightsaber = options.lightsaber || 'blue'; this.set('lightsaber', lightsaber); } set(key, val) { this[key] = val; } get(key) { return this[key]; } } 2. Events // bad $(this).trigger('listingUpdated', listing.id); // ... $(this).on('listingUpdated', (e, listingID) => { // do something with listingID }); // good $(this).trigger('listingUpdated', { listingID: listing.id }); // ... $(this).on('listingUpdated', (e, data) => { // do something with data.listingID }); 3. jQuery // bad const sidebar = $('.sidebar'); // good const $sidebar = $('.sidebar'); // good const $sidebarBtn = $('.sidebar-btn'); // bad function setSidebar() { $('.sidebar').hide(); // ... $('.sidebar').css({ 'background-color': 'pink', }); } // good function setSidebar() { const $sidebar = $('.sidebar'); $sidebar.hide(); // ... $sidebar.css({ 'background-color': 'pink', }); } For DOM queries use Cascading $('.sidebar ul') or parent > child $('.sidebar > ul'). jsPerf Use find with scoped jQuery object queries. // bad $('ul', '.sidebar').hide(); // bad $('.sidebar').find('ul').hide(); // good $('.sidebar ul').hide(); // good $('.sidebar > ul').hide(); // good $sidebar.find('ul').hide(); Thanks for your time. Best regards.  ( 3 min )

  • Open

    Á°¨Ê†∏ËßÇÂØü #665 ËÆ°ÁÆóÊú∫ÂéÜÂè≤ÂçöÁâ©È¶ÜÊÅ¢Â§ç‰∫Ü 21 ÈÉ® 1976 Âπ¥‰º†Â•áÊÄßËÆ°ÁÆóÊú∫‰ºöËÆÆÁöÑËßÜÈ¢ë

25 Âπ¥ÂéÜÂè≤„ÄÇÂú®Ëøô‰∫õ‰øÆÂ§çÁöÑËßÜÈ¢ë‰∏≠Ôºå‰∏é‰ºöËÄÖ‰ª¨ËÆ≤Ëø∞‰∫ÜËÆ∏Â§öÂΩìÊó∂È≤ú‰∏∫‰∫∫Áü•ÁöÑ‰∫ãÊÉÖ„ÄÇÊØîÂ¶ÇÔºåÁæéÂõΩÊúÄÊó©ÁöÑÂ§ßÂûãÁîµÂ≠êËÆ°ÁÆóÊú∫ ENIAC ÁöÑÂÖ±ÂêåÂèëÊòé‰∫∫Á∫¶Áø∞‚Ä¢ÊØõÂ•áÈáåËÆ®ËÆ∫‰∫ÜÂÆÉÁöÑ‰∏•ÈáçÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåENIAC ÂøÖÈ°ªÊØèÂ§© 24 Â∞èÊó∂‰øùÊåÅÈÄöÁîµÔºå‰ª•‰øùÊåÅÂÖ∂ 18000 ‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•Âú®ÁïåÈù¢‰∏äÁúãÂà∞Ê≠åÊõ≤ÁöÑËøõÂ∫¶„ÄÇËØ•Êí≠ÊîæÂô®‰∏éÈîÆÁõò‰∏äÁöÑÂ™í‰ΩìÊéßÂà∂ÊåâÈíÆÊï¥ÂêàÂæóÂæàÂ•Ω„ÄÇ‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•Áî®‰∏ìÁî®ÁöÑÂ™í‰ΩìÈîÆÊù•Êí≠Êîæ„ÄÅÊöÇÂÅúÂíåÊîπÂèòÊõ≤ÁõÆÔºàÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†ÁöÑÁ≥ªÁªü‰∏äÊúâÔºâ„ÄÇ     Âó®Ôºå‰ºôËÆ°‰ª¨ÔºåÂú®ËøôÁØáÊåáÂçó‰∏≠ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Â∞ÜÊºîÁ§∫Â¶Ç‰ΩïÂú® Windows 11 ÁöÑ‰πãÂ§ñÈÖçÁΩÆ Ubuntu 22.04 LTSÔºàJammy JellyfishÔºâÁöÑÂèåÂêØÂä®ËÆæÁΩÆ„ÄÇ ‰∏∫‰ΩøÂÖ∂ËÉΩÂ∑•‰ΩúÔºå‰Ω†ÈúÄË¶ÅÂú®‰Ω†ÁöÑËÆ°ÁÆóÊú∫‰∏äÂ∑≤ÁªèÂÆâË£ÖÂ•Ω‰∫Ü Windows 11 „ÄÇÊé•‰∏ãÊù•Ôºå‰Ω†Â∞ÜÈúÄË¶ÅÂú®‰Ω†ÁöÑÁ°¨ÁõòÈ©±Âä®Âô®‰∏äÂàõÂª∫‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂçïÁã¨ÁöÑÂàÜÂå∫Ôºå‰Ω†Â∞ÜÂú®Ê≠§ÂàÜÂå∫‰∏äÂÆâË£Ö Ubuntu 22.04 „ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨Â∞ÜÂåÖÂê´ËøôÁÇπÁü•ËØÜÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§‰∏çË¶ÅÊãÖÂøÉ„ÄÇ ÂâçÁΩÆÊù°‰ª∂Ôºö Âú®ËÆæÁΩÆÂèåÂêØÂä®ÂâçÔºåËøô‰∫õÊòØ‰Ω†ÊâÄÈúÄË¶ÅÁöÑÔºö ‰∏Ä‰∏™ Ubuntu 22.04 ÁöÑÂèØÂêØÂä® USB È©±Âä®Âô®Ôºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•ËΩ¨Âà∞¬†Ubuntu 22.04 ‰∏ãËΩΩÈ°µÈù¢¬†Êù•‰∏ãËΩΩ Ubuntu 22.04 ÁöÑ ISO ÈïúÂÉèÊñá‰ª∂„ÄÇÂú® ISO ÈïúÂÉèÊñá‰ª∂Âà∞‰ΩçÂêéÔºåÊãø‰∏Ä‰∏™ 16GB USB È©±Âä®Âô®ÔºåÂπ∂‰ΩøÁî® Rufus Â∫îÁî®Á®ãÂ∫èÊù•‰ΩøÂÖ∂ÂèØÂêØÂä®„ÄÇ Âø´ÈÄüÁ®≥ÂÆöÁöÑ‰∫íËÅîÁΩëËøûÊé• Ê≠•È™§ 1„ÄÅÂú®‰Ω†ÁöÑÁ°¨ÁõòÈ©±Âä®Âô®‰∏äÂàõÂª∫‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂèØÁî®ÁöÑÂàÜÂå∫ Ê≠£Â¶Ç‰ªãÁªç‰∏≠ÊâÄÊèêÂà∞ÁöÑÔºåÊàë‰ª¨È¶ñÂÖàÈúÄË¶ÅÂú®Á°¨ÁõòÈ©±Âä®Âô®‰∏äÂàõÂª∫‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂçïÁã¨ÁöÑÂàÜÂå∫ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Â∞ÜÂú®ÂÖ∂‰∏≠ÂÆâË£Ö Ubuntu 22.04 „ÄÇ Âõ†Ê≠§ÔºåÈÄöËøáÊåâ‰∏ã¬†Windows + R¬†ÁªÑÂêàÈîÆÊù•ÊâìÂºÄÁ£ÅÁõòÁÆ°ÁêÜÂô®ÂÆûÁî®Á®ãÂ∫è„ÄÇ Âú®ÂØπËØùÊ°Ü‰∏≠ÔºåËæìÂÖ•¬†diskmgmt.msc¬†ÔºåÂπ∂Êåâ‰∏ãÂõûËΩ¶ÈîÆ„ÄÇ Á£ÅÁõòÁÆ°ÁêÜdisk managementÊéßÂà∂Âè∞Â∞ÜÊòæÁ§∫ÂΩìÂâçÁ£ÅÁõòÂàÜÂå∫ÔºåÂ¶Ç‰Ω†Â∞ÜÂú®‰∏ãÈù¢ÊâÄÁúãÂà∞ÁöÑ‰∏ÄÊ†∑„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨Â∞ÜÈÄöËøáÂéãÁº© ‚ÄúÂç∑ E‚Äù Êù•ÂàõÂª∫‰∏Ä‰∏™Áî®‰∫éÂÆâË£Ö Ubuntu ÁöÑÂàÜÂå∫„ÄÇËøôÂú®‰Ω†ÁöÑÂÆâË£ÖËøáÁ®ã‰∏≠ÂèØËÉΩÊúâÊâÄ‰∏çÂêåÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÂè™ÈúÄË¶ÅË∑üÁùÄÂÅöÔºå‰Ω†Â∞±‰ºöÁêÜËß£ÂÖ∂‰∏≠ÁöÑÂ§ß‰ΩìÊÑèÊÄù„ÄÇ Âõ†Ê≠§ÔºåÂú®‰Ω†ÊÉ≥Ë¶ÅÂéãÁº©ÁöÑÁ£ÅÁõòÈ©±Âä®Âô®Âç∑‰∏äÁÇπÂáªÈº†Ê†áÂè≥ÈîÆÔºåÂπ∂Âú®ÂºπÂá∫ÁöÑËèúÂçï‰∏≠ÈÄâÊã©¬†ÂéãÁº©Âç∑Shrink¬†ÈÄâÈ°π„ÄÇ Â∞Ü‰ºöÂá∫Áé∞‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂºπÂá∫ÂØπËØùÊ°ÜÔºåÂ¶Ç‰∏ãÊâÄÁ§∫„ÄÇÂÖ∑‰ΩìÊåáÂÆöÂéãÁº©ÁöÑÊéß‰ª∂Â§ßÂ∞èÔºà‰ª• MB ‰∏∫Âçï‰ΩçÔºâÔºåÂπ∂ÂçïÂáª¬†ÂéãÁº©Âç∑Shrink¬†„ÄÇ ËøôÊòØÊåáÂÆöÁªô Ubuntu 22.04 ÂÆâË£ÖÊâÄÁî®ÁöÑÁ©∫Èó¥„ÄÇ Âú®Áº©‚Ä¶  ( 1 min )

Á™ÅÁÑ∂ÊÄßËÄ≥ËÅãÊúÄÂ§ßÁöÑÁâπÁÇπÔºåÂ∞±ÊòØ‚ÄúÁ™ÅÁÑ∂‚ÄùÔºåÂæÄÂæÄÂú®‰Ω†ÊÑüËßâÂà∞Êúâ‰∏çÈÄÇÊó∂ÔºåÂ∞±ÊÑèÂë≥ÁùÄÂøÖÈ°ªË¶ÅÈ©¨‰∏äÂ∞±Âåª‰∫Ü„ÄÇÂπ∂‰∏îÔºåËôΩÁÑ∂Â≠¶Âêç‰∏∫Á™ÅÂèëÊÄßËÄ≥ËÅãÁöÑÔºå‰ΩÜËøôÁßçÁñæÁóÖÂçÅÂàÜÁã°ÁåæÔºåËÄ≥ËÅãÂπ∂‰∏çÊòØÂîØ‰∏Ä‰∏ÄÁßçÁóáÁä∂ÔºåÁîöËá≥Âú®ÁóÖÁ®ãÂàùÊúüÔºåÂπ∂‰∏ç‰∏ÄÂÆö‰ºö‚ÄúËÅã‚ÄùÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ÂÖ®Èù¢‰∫ÜËß£ÊâÄÊúâÂèØËÉΩÂá∫Áé∞ÁöÑÁóáÁä∂ÊòØÂØπÂÆÉÈò≤ÊÇ£‰∫éÊú™ÁÑ∂ÁöÑÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÊ≠•„ÄÇ     service517: Ê∑ªÂä† google ad manager ÂêéÔºåÊ≠£Á°ÆÊòæÁ§∫ adsense ÁöÑÂπøÂëä„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊòØÂú®ÊéßÂà∂Âè∞‰ºöÊä•ÈîôÔºö GPT] Exception in googletag.cmd function: TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'addService'). Âà∞Â∫ïÊòØÂì™‰∏™ÁéØËäÇÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢òÔºü ‰∏ãÈù¢ÊòØÊú¨Âú∞ÁöÑ‰ª£Á†Å import Head from 'next/head'; import { useEffect } from 'react'; const useDfpSlot = ({ path, size, id }) => { useEffect(() => { if(window){ const googletag = window['googletag'] || {}; googletag.cmd = googletag.cmd || []; googletag.cmd.push(() => { googletag.defineSlot(path, size, id).addService(googletag.pubads()); googletag.pubads().enableSingleRequest(); googletag.enableServices(); googletag.display(id); }); } }, [path, size, id]); }; // ‰æßËæπÊ†èÂπøÂëä export const AdSidebar = () => { useDfpSlot({ path: '/20000000000/Sidebar', size: [160,600], id: 'div-gpt-ad-10000000000-0', }); return ( { useDfpSlot({ path: '/20000000000/ads/inbox-Ad', size: [[728, 90],[970, 90]], id: 'div-gpt-ad-10000000000-0', }); return ( { useDfpSlot({ path: '/20000000000/ads', size: [728, 90], id: 'div-gpt-ad-10000000000-0', }); return ( ); };  ( 1 min )

    Prideeeeee: Áé∞Âú®Âú®‰∏ÄÁ∫ø‰∫íËÅîÁΩëÂÖ¨Âè∏ÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫ÂÖ¨Âè∏ÂèëÂ±ïÂèóÈòªÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ÊúÄËøëÊúâÊç¢Â∑•‰ΩúÁöÑÊÉ≥Ê≥ïÔºåÊâãÈáåÂá†‰∏™ offer ÁõÆÂâçÂ∞±ËßâÂæó Zoom ËøòË°åÔºåÈÅÇÊúâÊ≠§Ë¥¥Ôºå‰∏çÊòØÊ±ÇËÅåÂçïÁ∫ØÊòØ‰∏∫‰∫ÜÂí®ËØ¢ÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•Ê≤°ÊúâÂèëÂú®„ÄåÈÖ∑Â∑•‰Ωú„Äç„ÄÇ ÂÖàÊù•ËØ¥‰∏Ä‰∏ã‰∏™‰∫∫ÊÉÖÂÜµ: 2021 Âπ¥Ê†°Êãõ ssp ÔºåÊó†ËÇ°Á•® Â∏¶‰∏ÄÊù°‰∏öÂä°Á∫øÁöÑÂçïÁã¨‰∏öÂä°ÂàÜÊîØÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØ‰∏öÂä°Âõ†‰∏∫ÊîøÁ≠ñÈóÆÈ¢òËøüËøüÊó†Ê≥ï‰∏äÁ∫ø ÂêéÂçäÂπ¥ÊúâÊú∫‰ºöÊôãÂçáÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÂèØËÉΩÊÄß‰∏çÂ§ßÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫ÂêéÂçäÂπ¥Á™óÂè£ÊØîËæÉÂ∞è Â≠óËäÇ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊúàÂâç‰∏âÈù¢ÊåÇËøáÔºåÁé∞Âú®Ë¢´ÊçûËµ∑Êù•ÊµÅÁ®ã‰∏≠ÔºåËøòÊ≤°Èù¢ÂÆåÔºåËµ∞ÂÆå‰º∞ËÆ°‰∏§Âë® ÂÜçÊù•ËØ¥‰∏ã Zoom ÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµ: Zoom Áªô‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™Âπ≥ÁöÑÊÄªÂåÖ Ê≤°Êúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊòéÁ°ÆÁöÑÁ∫ßÂà´‰ΩìÁ≥ªÂíåÊôãÂçáËßÑÂàô Ëñ™ËµÑÊúâ 1/3 ËÇ°Á•®ÊûÑÊàêÔºåÊúà base ÊØîÁõÆÂâç‰Ωé 10+ Êàë‰∏çÂ§™Ê∏ÖÊ•öÁæéËÇ°ÂèòÁé∞ËßÑÂàôÔºåÊâãÁª≠Ë¥πÂíåÁ®é‰πãÁ±ª‰∏çÊòØÂæàÊáÇ ÊàëÁöÑÈ°æËôë: ËøîÂõû‰∫íËÅîÁΩë‰ºö‰∏ç‰ºöË¢´Âç°Á∫ßÂà´„ÄÅÂç°Ê∂®ÂπÖÔºü Âú® Zoom ‰ºö‰∏ç‰ºöÊàêÈïøÂÅúÊªû Zoom Âú®ÂêéÁñ´ÊÉÖÊó∂‰ª£‰ºö‰∏ç‰ºöÂèëÂ±ïÂèóÈòªÔºü ÊÑüË∞¢ÂêÑ‰ΩçÂ§ß‰Ω¨ÂêÑÊäíÂ∑±ËßÅüôè  ( 1 min )

While the rules aren‚Äôt wide-reaching (again, they only apply to Dutch dating apps), they do show what Apple‚Äôs willing to do to comply with government regulation ‚Äî which it could be facing a lot more of as the EU and US gear up to fight tech monopolies, and potentially even force the company to d...     theme: v-green highlight: atom-one-dark ÊåÅÁª≠Âàõ‰ΩúÔºåÂä†ÈÄüÊàêÈïøÔºÅËøôÊòØÊàëÂèÇ‰∏é„ÄåÊéòÈáëÊó•Êñ∞ËÆ°Âàí ¬∑ 6 ÊúàÊõ¥ÊñáÊåëÊàò„ÄçÁöÑÁ¨¨1Â§©ÔºåÁÇπÂáªÊü•ÁúãÊ¥ªÂä®ËØ¶ÊÉÖ ÂâçË®Ä Âú®ËÅäÂ§©Á±ªÂ∫îÁî®‰∏≠ÔºåÈÄöÂ∏∏Áî®Ê∞îÊ≥°‰Ωú‰∏∫ËÅäÂ§©ÂÜÖÂÆπÁöÑËÉåÊôØËâ≤ÔºåÊØîÂ¶ÇÂæÆ‰ø°ÁöÑËÅäÂ§©ËÉåÊôØÔºåÂà´‰∫∫ÂèëËøáÊù•ÁöÑÊòØÁôΩËâ≤ÁöÑÊ∞îÊ≥°ÔºåËá™Â∑±ÂèëÁöÑÊòØÁªøËâ≤ÁöÑÊ∞îÊ≥°„ÄÇ ‰∏äÈù¢ËøôÁßçÊòØÊØîËæÉÊôÆÈÄöÁöÑÔºåËøôÁØáÊàë‰ª¨Áé©ÁÇπÊúâË∂£ÁöÑÔºåËÆ©ËÅäÂ§©Ê∞îÊ≥°ÊòØÊ∏êÂèòËâ≤ÁöÑ„ÄÇÂèØËÉΩÂæàÂ§ö‰∫∫‰ºöËßâÂæóÊ∏êÂèòÂæàÁÆÄÂçïÔºåÁªô Container Êù•‰∏™decorationÊàñËÄÖ‰ΩøÁî® DecoratedBoxÔºå‰ΩøÁî®Ê∏êÂèòÂ°´ÂÖÖËâ≤Â∞±ÂèØ‰ª•‰∫ÜÔºåÊØîÂ¶Ç‰∏ãÈù¢ËøôÁßçÊïàÊûúÔºö Ëøô‰∏™ÊÑüËßâ‰πüÂ§™‰∏ë‰∫ÜüòÇüòÇüòÇÔºåÊú¨ÁØáÊàë‰ª¨Êù•‰∏Ä‰∏™È´òÁ∫ßÁöÑ ‚Äî‚Äî Êï¥‰∏™ËÅäÂ§©Á™óÂè£ÁöÑÊ∞îÊ≥°È¢úËâ≤ÊòØÊ∏êÂèòÁöÑÔºåËÄå‰∏îÈöèÁùÄÊªöÂä®Ëøò‰ºöÂèòÂåñÔºÅÂÖàÁúãÁúãÂÆûÁé∞ÁöÑÊïàÊûúÔºåËøôÈáåÊúâ‰∏§‰∏™ÊïàÊûúÔºö Êï¥‰∏™Á™óÂè£ÁöÑËÅäÂ§©Ê∞îÊ≥°ËÉåÊôØËâ≤ÊòØËøûÁª≠Ê∏êÂèòÁöÑÔºåËÄå‰∏çÊòØÊØè‰∏™Ê∞îÊ≥°ÈáçÂ§çÁöÑÊ∏êÂèò„ÄÇ ÊªöÂä®ÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÔºåÊ∞îÊ≥°ÁöÑËÉåÊôØËâ≤‰ºöÈöèÁùÄÊªöÂä®ÁöÑ‰ΩçÁΩÆÂèòÂåñ„ÄÇ ‰ª£Á†ÅÂÆûÁé∞ ‰ΩøÁî® Container ÁöÑ decoration Êàñ DecoratedBox Âè™ËÉΩÂú®Ê∏≤Êüì‰πãÂâçÂ∞±Á°ÆÂÆöÂ•ΩËÉåÊôØËâ≤ÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§Ê≤°Ê≥ïÂú®ÁªòÂà∂ËøáÁ®ã‰∏≠Âä®ÊÄÅÊîπÂèòÊ∞îÊ≥°ÁöÑËÉåÊôØËâ≤ÔºåË¶ÅÂä®ÊÄÅÊîπÂèòÊ∞îÊ≥°ËÉåÊôØËâ≤Â∞±ÈúÄË¶ÅËá™Â∑±ÁªòÂà∂ËÉåÊôØÔºåÈÇ£Â∞±ÈúÄË¶Å‰ΩøÁî®Âà∞ CustomPaint„ÄÇ È¶ñÂÖàÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Êù•ÁúãÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÁªòÂà∂Ê∏êÂèòËÉåÊôØËâ≤„ÄÇÁîªÁ¨î Paint ÂØπË±°Êúâ‰∏™shader Â±ûÊÄßÔºåÂèØ‰ª•ÈÖçÁΩÆÁªòÂà∂Êó∂ÁöÑÂ°´ÂÖÖË°å‰∏∫„ÄÇÊù•Ê∫êÂèØ‰ª•ÊòØÊ∏êÂèòÂ°´ÂÖÖÁöÑ Gradient ÂØπË±°ÔºåÊàñÊòØÂõæÁâáÁöÑ Image ÂØπË±°„ÄÇÊØîÂ¶ÇÊàë‰ª¨Ë¶ÅÁî®Á∫øÊÄßÊ∏êÂèòÂ°´ÂÖÖÔºåÈÇ£Â∞±ÂèØ‰ª•‰ΩøÁî®‰∏ãÈù¢ÁöÑ‰ª£Á†ÅÂÆûÁé∞Ôºö final paint = Paint() ..shader = LinearGradient( begin: Alignment.topCenter, end: Alignment.bottomCenter, colors: colors ).createShader(rect); ÂÖ∂‰∏≠ cr‚Ä¶
    „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - ÊãæÊüí„ÄëÊûÑ‰ª∂ÁâπÊïà | ‰∫ÜËß£ Effect ‰ΩìÁ≥ª
    theme: cyanosis ÊåÅÁª≠Âàõ‰ΩúÔºåÂä†ÈÄüÊàêÈïøÔºÅËøôÊòØÊàëÂèÇ‰∏é„ÄåÊéòÈáëÊó•Êñ∞ËÆ°Âàí ¬∑ 6 ÊúàÊõ¥ÊñáÊåëÊàò„ÄçÁöÑÁ¨¨ 18 Â§©ÔºåÁÇπÂáªÊü•ÁúãÊ¥ªÂä®ËØ¶ÊÉÖ ÂâçË®Ä ËøôÊòØ‰∏ÄÂ•ó Âº†È£éÊç∑ÁâπÁÉà Âá∫ÂìÅÁöÑ Flutter&Flame Á≥ªÂàóÊïôÁ®ãÔºåÂèëÂ∏É‰∫éÊéòÈáëÁ§æÂå∫„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†Âú®ÂÖ∂‰ªñÂπ≥Âè∞ÁúãÂà∞Êú¨ÊñáÔºåÂèØ‰ª•Ê†πÊçÆÂØπ‰∫éÈìæÊé•ÁßªÊ≠•Âà∞ÊéòÈáë‰∏≠Êü•Áúã„ÄÇÂõ†‰∏∫ÊñáÁ´†ÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÊõ¥Êñ∞„ÄÅ‰øÆÊ≠£Ôºå‰∏ÄÂàá‰ª•ÊéòÈáëÊñáÁ´†ÁâàÊú¨‰∏∫ÂáÜ„ÄÇÊú¨Á≥ªÂàóÊ∫êÁ†Å‰∫é „Äêtoly_game„Äë ÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÊú¨Á≥ªÂàóÂØπ‰Ω†ÊúâÊâÄÂ∏ÆÂä©ÔºåÂ∏åÊúõÁÇπËµûÊîØÊåÅÔºåÊú¨Á≥ªÂàóÊñáÁ´†‰∏ÄËßàÔºö „ÄêFlutter&Flame Ê∏∏Êàè - Â£π„ÄëÂºÄÂêØÊñ∞‰∏ñÁïåÁöÑÂ§ßÈó® „ÄêFlutter&Flame Ê∏∏Êàè - Ë¥∞„ÄëÊìçÁ∫µÊùÜ‰∏éËßíËâ≤ÁßªÂä® „ÄêFlutter&Flame Ê∏∏Êàè - ÂèÅ„ÄëÈîÆÁõò‰∫ã‰ª∂‰∏éÊâãÂäøÊìç‰Ωú „ÄêFlutter&Flame Ê∏∏Êàè - ËÇÜ„ÄëÁ≤æÁÅµÂõæÁâáÂä†ËΩΩÊñπÂºè „ÄêFlutter&Flame Ê∏∏Êàè - ‰ºç„ÄëCanvas ÂèÇ‰∏ä | ËßíËâ≤ÁöÑË°ÄÊù° „ÄêFlutter&Flame Ê∏∏Êàè - ÈôÜ„ÄëÊö¥Âáª Dash | ÊñáÂ≠óÊûÑ‰ª∂ÁöÑ‰ΩøÁî® „ÄêFlutter&Flame Ê∏∏Êàè - Êüí„Äë‰∫∫ÈöèÊåáÂä® | Âä®ÁîªÁÇπËß¶‰∏éÁßªÂä® „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - Êçå„ÄëË£ÖÂºπÂÆåÊØï | ËßíËâ≤Ê≠¶Âô®ÂèëÂ∞Ñ „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - Áéñ„ÄëÊé¢Á¥¢ÊûÑ‰ª∂ | Component ÊòØ‰ªÄ‰πà „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - Êãæ„ÄëÊé¢Á¥¢ÊûÑ‰ª∂ | Component ÁîüÂëΩÂë®ÊúüÂõûË∞É „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - ÊãæÂ£π„ÄëÊé¢Á¥¢ÊûÑ‰ª∂ | Component ‰ΩøÁî®ÁªÜËäÇ „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - ÊãæË¥∞„ÄëÊé¢Á¥¢ÊûÑ‰ª∂ | ËßíËâ≤ÁÆ°ÁêÜ „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - ÊãæÂèÅ„ÄëÁ¢∞ÊíûÊ£ÄÊµã | CollisionCallbacks „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - ÊãæËÇÜ„ÄëÁ¢∞ÊíûÊ£ÄÊµã | ‰πãÂâç‰ª£Á†Å‰ºòÂåñ „ÄêFlutter&FlameÊ∏∏Êàè - Êãæ‰ºç„ÄëÁ≤íÂ≠êÁ≥ªÁªü | ParticleSystemComponent „ÄêF‚Ä¶
    ÂºÄÁÆ±Âç≥Áî®-AndroidËÆæËÆ°Ê®°ÂºèÂÆûÊàò-Êã¶Êà™ÂºπÁ™óÂ±ïÁ§∫
    theme: juejin highlight: a11y-dark ÊåÅÁª≠Âàõ‰ΩúÔºåÂä†ÈÄüÊàêÈïøÔºÅËøôÊòØÊàëÂèÇ‰∏é„ÄåÊéòÈáëÊó•Êñ∞ËÆ°Âàí¬†¬∑¬†6¬†ÊúàÊõ¥ÊñáÊåëÊàò„ÄçÁöÑÁ¨¨2Â§©ÔºåÁÇπÂáªÊü•ÁúãÊ¥ªÂä®ËØ¶ÊÉÖ Android‰∏≠Â§ö‰∏™ÂºπÁ™óÁöÑÊéíÈòüÂ±ïÁ§∫ Âú®ÂÆûÈôÖÁöÑÂºÄÂèë‰∏≠ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨‰ºöÈÅáÂà∞Â§ö‰∏™ÂºπÁ™óÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÂèà‰∏çËÉΩ‰∏ÄÊ¨°ÂÖ®ÈÉ®ÂºπÂá∫ÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•Êàë‰ª¨ÁöÑ‰ª£Á†ÅÂ∞±ÊòØ if else if else Âæ™ÁéØÂµåÂ•ó„ÄÇ ‰æãÂ¶ÇÊàë‰ª¨Âú®Â∑•‰ΩúËØ¶ÊÉÖ‰∏≠Áî≥ËØ∑‰∏Ä‰∏™Â∑•‰ΩúÔºåÈ¶ñÂÖàÊàë‰ª¨Â∞±Ë¶ÅËµ∞‰∏Ä‰∏™Ê†°È™åÊé•Âè£ÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÊé•Âè£‰ºöÂëäËØâÈúÄË¶ÅÂà§Êñ≠ÁöÑÂØπË±°„ÄÇÂ¶Ç‰∏ãÂà§Êñ≠ÈÄªËæëÔºö È¶ñÂÖàÈúÄË¶ÅÂÖàÂà§Êñ≠ÊòØÂê¶ÊòØÊñ∞Áî®Êà∑ÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÊòØÊñ∞Áî®Êà∑ÈúÄË¶ÅÂéªÂèÇÂä†Á∫ø‰∏äÂüπËÆ≠ÔºàË∑≥ËΩ¨È°µÈù¢Ôºâ Âà§Êñ≠Áî®Êà∑ÊòØÂê¶ÂÆåÂñÑ‰∫Ü‰∏™‰∫∫‰ø°ÊÅØÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÊ≤°ÊúâÈúÄË¶ÅÂéªÂÆåÂñÑ‰∏™‰∫∫‰ø°ÊÅØ ÔºàË∑≥ËΩ¨È°µÈù¢Ôºâ Âà§Êñ≠‰∏™‰∫∫Áî®Â∑•Áä∂ÊÄÅÊòØÂê¶ÊòØApproveÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰∏™‰∫∫Áä∂ÊÄÅ‰∏çÂØπÈúÄË¶ÅËÅîÁ≥ªÁÆ°ÁêÜÂëò ÔºàÊã®ÊâìÁîµËØùÔºâ Âà§Êñ≠ÂΩìÂâçÁî®Êà∑ÊòØÂê¶Â°´ÂÜô‰∫ÜÊØèÊó•Êñ∞ÂÜ†Êä•ÂëäÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÊ≤°ÊúâÈúÄË¶ÅÂ°´ÂÜôÊñ∞ÂÜ†Ë°®ÂçïÔºàË∑≥ËΩ¨ÊµèËßàÂô®Ôºâ Âà§Êñ≠ÂΩìÂâçÁî≥ËØ∑ÁöÑÂ∑•‰ΩúÊòØÂê¶ÈúÄË¶ÅÊäºÈáëÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúË¶ÅÊäºÈáëÂºπÊ°ÜÊèêÁ§∫ÔºàÂºπÊ°ÜÔºâ Â¶ÇÊûúÈúÄË¶ÅÊäºÈáëÔºå‰Ω†ÁöÑÈí±ÂåÖÂèàÊÅ∞Â•ΩÊúâÈí±Ôºå‰ºöÊèêÁ§∫ÊòØÂê¶ÊääÈí±ÂåÖÁöÑÈí±ÂÖÖÂÄºÂà∞ÊäºÈáëÔºàÂºπÊ°ÜÔºâ Â¶ÇÊûúÊîπÂ∑•‰ΩúÈúÄË¶Å‰∫∫ËÑ∏‰ø°ÊÅØÔºåÈúÄË¶Å‰Ω†ÈááÈõÜ‰∫∫ËÑ∏ ÔºàË∑≥ËΩ¨È°µÈù¢Ôºâ Â¶ÇÊûúÊòØÈùûÁõ¥Ëê•ÁöÑÂ∑•‰ΩúÔºå‰ºöÊèêÁ§∫‰Ω†ÈùûËá™Ëê•Â∑•‰Ωú ÔºàÂºπÁ™óÔºâ Â¶ÇÊûúËØ•Â∑•‰ΩúÈúÄË¶Åwhat's app ‰ºöÂºπÁ™óÊèêÁ§∫‰Ω†ËæìÂÖ•Ë¥¶Âè∑ ÔºàÂºπÊ°ÜÔºâ Â¶ÇÊûúËØ•Â∑•‰ΩúÊòØÈì∂Ë°åÂç°ÁªìÁÆóÔºå‰Ω†ÂèàÊ≤°ÊúâÈì∂Ë°åÂç°‰ø°ÊÅØÔºåÈúÄË¶ÅÂ°´ÂÜôÈì∂Ë°åÂç°ÔºàÊñ∞È°µÈù¢Ôºâ ... ÁúüÂÆû‰∏öÂä°ËÇØÂÆö‰∏çÊ≠¢10‰∏™Êù°‰ª∂‰∫ÜÔºåËøôÈáåÂ∞±ÂÖàÂÜô10‰∏™Âêß„ÄÇÊù•ÔºåÈîÆÁõòÁªô‰Ω†Ôºå‰Ω†Êù•ÂÜôif else „ÄÇ‰Ω†ÂÜôÂÆå‰∫ÜÔºü ‰∏≠Èó¥Á¨¨5‰∏™ÂêéÈù¢ÂÜçÂä†‰∏Ä‰∏™Âà§Êñ≠ Â¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†Ê≤°ÊúâÂ°´ÂÜôÊäÄËÉΩ ÂéªÊñ∞È°µÈù¢Â°´ÂÜô‰Ω†ÁöÑÊäÄËÉΩÔºÅ Ëøô‰πàÂ§öif else ‰∏≠‰Ω†ÁúüÁöÑÊîπÁöÑÂä®ÂêóÔºü ‰ªÄ‰πàÔºü‰Ω†‰∏öÂä°‰∏≠Â∞±ÊòØËøô‰πàÂÜôÁöÑÔºü‰Ω†ÊîπÁöÑÂä®Ôºü Â∞±ÂñúÊ¨¢ËøôÁßçÊú¥ÂÆûÊó†ÂçéÁöÑÁ®ãÂ∫èÂëòÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÂë¢Áõ∏‰ø°ÊàëÔºåÁúüÁöÑÈùûÂ∏∏ÁÆÄÂçï„ÄÇÊØïÁ´üÂÅ∑ÊáíÊâçÊòØÁ®ãÂ∫èÂëòÁöÑÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÁîü‰∫ßÂäõÔºåÊâÄÊúâÁöÑËÆæËÆ°Ê®°ÂºèÔºåÊ°ÜÊû∂ÔºåÂ∞ÅË£Ö‰ªÄ‰πàÁöÑÔºåÈÉΩÊòØ‰∏∫‰∫ÜÂÅ∑ÊáíÔºåËÆ©Êàë‰ª¨Êõ¥ËΩªÊùæ‰∏ÄÁÇπ„ÄÇÊù•ÂêßÔºåÁúãÁúãÊàëÁöÑÂÆûÁé∞ÔºÅ ‰∏Ä„ÄÅÊã¶Êà™Âô®Ê®°ÂºèÁöÑÂÆö‰πâ ÁúüÊ≠£ÁöÑÂÆûÁé∞Ôºö ÂÆö‰πâÊã¶Êà™Âô®Êé•‚Ä¶

    ÊåÅÁª≠Âàõ‰ΩúÔºåÂä†ÈÄüÊàêÈïøÔºÅËøôÊòØÊàëÂèÇ‰∏é„ÄåÊéòÈáëÊó•Êñ∞ËÆ°Âàí ¬∑ 6 ÊúàÊõ¥ÊñáÊåëÊàò„ÄçÁöÑÁ¨¨1Â§©ÔºåÁÇπÂáªÊü•ÁúãÊ¥ªÂä®ËØ¶ÊÉÖ ËÉåÊôØ ÂØπ‰∫é‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊôÆÈÄöÁöÑandroidÂ∫îÁî®Êù•ËØ¥ÔºåsoÂ∫ìÁöÑÂç†ÊØîÈÄöÂ∏∏ÈÉΩÊòØÂ∑®È´ò‰∏ç‰∏ãÁöÑÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫Êàë‰ª¨Êó†ÂèØÈÅøÂÖçÁöÑÂú®ÂºÄÂèë‰∏≠ÈÅáÂà∞ÂêÑÁßçÂêÑÊ†∑ÈúÄË¶ÅÁî®Âà∞nativeÁöÑÈúÄÊ±ÇÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•soÂ∫ìÁöÑÂä®ÊÄÅÂåñÂèØ‰ª•ÂáèÂ∞ëÊûÅÂ§ßÁöÑÂåÖ‰ΩìÁßØÔºåËá™‰ªé2020ËÖæËÆØÁöÑbuglyÂõ¢ÈòüÂèëÈÉ®ÂÖ≥‰∫éÂä®ÊÄÅÂåñsoÁöÑÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÊñáÁ´†ÂêéÔºåÂ∑≤ÁªèËøáÂéª‰∏§Âπ¥‰∫ÜÔºåÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÊñáÁ´†ÔºåÁªèËøá‰∏§Âπ¥ÁöÑËÄÉÈ™åÔºåÂÆûÈôÖ‰∏äsoÂä®ÊÄÅÂä†ËΩΩ‰πüÊòØÈùûÂ∏∏ÊàêÁÜüÁöÑ‰∏ÄÈ°πÊäÄÊúØ‰∫ÜÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÂæàÈÅóÊÜæÔºåËÆ∏Â§öÂÖ¨Âè∏ÈÉΩËøòÊ≤°ÊúâËøôÊñπÈù¢ÁöÑÊ∂âÁï•ÂèàÊàñËÄÖËØ¥‰∏çÁü•ÈÅì‰ªéÂì™ÈáåÂºÄÂßãËøõË°åÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫soÂä®ÊÄÅÂÖ∂ÂÆûÊ∂âÂèäÂà∞‰∏ãËΩΩÔºåsoÁâàÊú¨ÁÆ°ÁêÜÔºåÂä®ÊÄÅÂä†ËΩΩÂÆûÁé∞Á≠âÂ§öÊñπÈù¢ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨‰∏çÂ¶®ÊäõÂºÄËøô‰∫õÈ¢ùÂ§ñÁöÑ‰∏úË•øÔºå‰ªéÊúÄÊú¨Ë¥®ÁöÑsoÂä®ÊÄÅÂä†ËΩΩÂá∫ÂèëÂêßÔºÅËøôÈáåÊòØÊú¨Ê¨°ÁöÑ‰æãÂ≠êÔºåÊàëÊääÂÆÉÂëΩÂêç‰∏∫sillyboyÔºåÊ¨¢ËøéprËøòÊúâÂêéÁª≠ÁÇπËµûÂëÄÔºÅ soÂä®ÊÄÅÂä†ËΩΩ‰ªãÁªç Âä®ÊÄÅÂä†ËΩΩÔºåÂÖ∂ÂÆûÂ∞±ÊòØÊääÊàë‰ª¨ÁöÑsoÂ∫ìÂú®ÊâìÂåÖÊàêapkÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÂâîÈô§ÔºåÂú®ÂêàÈÄÇÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÈÄöËøáÁΩëÁªúÂåÖ‰∏ãËΩΩÁöÑÊñπÂºèÔºåÈÄöËøá‰∏Ä‰∫õÊâãÊÆµÔºåÂú®ËøêË°åÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôËøõË°åÂàÜÁ¶ªÂä†ËΩΩÁöÑËøáÁ®ã„ÄÇËøôÈáåÊ∂âÂèäÂà∞‰∏ãËΩΩÂô®ÔºåËøòÊúâ‰∏ãËΩΩÂêéÁöÑÁâàÊú¨ÁÆ°ÁêÜÁ≠âÁ≠âÁ°Æ‰øù‰∏Ä‰∏™soÂ∫ìË¢´Ê≠£Á°ÆÁöÑÂä†ËΩΩÁ≠âËøáÁ®ãÔºåÂú®ËøôÈáåÔºåÊàë‰ª¨‰∏çËÆ®ËÆ∫Ëøô‰∫õËæÖÂä©ÁöÑÊµÅÁ®ãÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Áúã‰∏ãÊÄé‰πàÂÆûÁé∞‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊúÄÁÆÄÂçïÁöÑÂä†ËΩΩÊµÅÁ®ã„ÄÇ ‰ªé‰∏Ä‰∏™‰æãÂ≠êÂá∫Âèë Êàë‰ª¨ÊûÑÂª∫‰∏Ä‰∏™nativeÂ∑•Á®ãÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÂú®ÈáåÈù¢ÁºñÂÖ•Â¶Ç‰∏ãÂÜÖÂÆπÔºå‰∏ãÈù¢ÊòØcmake # For more information about using CMake with Android Studio, read the # documentation: https://d.android.com/studio/projects/add-native-code.html # Sets the minimum version of CMake required to build the native library. cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.‚Ä¶

ÊúàË¢´ÂèëÁé∞Ôºå‰ºº‰πéÊòØÈíàÂØπÈáëËûçÈÉ®Èó®ÁâπÂà´ÂºÄÂèëÁöÑ„ÄÇÂÆÉ‰∏çÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™‰ª•ÊÑüÊüìÊú∫Âô®ÁöÑÁã¨Á´ãÂèØÊâßË°åÊñá‰ª∂ÁöÑÂΩ¢ÂºèËøêË°åÁöÑÔºåËÄåÊòØ‰ª•‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂÖ±‰∫´ÂØπË±°Â∫ìÁöÑÂΩ¢ÂºèÂä†ËΩΩÂà∞ÊâÄÊúâÊ≠£Âú®ËøêË°åÁöÑËøõÁ®ã‰∏≠ÔºåÂπ∂ÂØÑÁîüÊÑüÊüìÊú∫Âô®„ÄÇÂÆÉÈááÁî®‰∫ÜÂ§öÁßçËßÑÈÅøÊ£ÄÊµãÁöÑÊâãÊÆµÔºåÊù•ÈöêËóèÊñá‰ª∂„ÄÅËøõÁ®ãÂíåÁΩëÁªúÊµÅÈáèÔºåÁîöËá≥ËÉΩËÆ© BPF Â∑•ÂÖ∑‰πüÊó†Ê≥ïÂèëÁé∞ÂÖ∂ÁΩëÁªúÊµÅÈáè„ÄÇ Ê∂àÊÅØÊù•Ê∫êÔºöÈªëËéì ËÄÅÁéãÁÇπËØÑÔºöÂÖ∂ÂÆûÈÄöËøáÂÖ±‰∫´ÂØπË±°Â∫ìÂØÑÁîüÁöÑÊú®È©¨Âπ∂‰∏çÁ®ÄÂ•áÔºåÂè™ÊòØËøô‰∏™Êú®È©¨ÂÅö‰∫ÜÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑÈöêËóèÊâãÊÆµÔºåÂèØËßÅÁé∞Âú®ÈíàÂØπ Linux ÁöÑÊú®È©¨‰πüË∂äÊù•Ë∂äÂº∫Â§ßÈöêËîΩ‰∫Ü„ÄÇ Ubuntu Ê≠£Âú®ÊîπËøõÂØπ‰ΩéÊàêÊú¨ RISC-V ‰∏ªÊùø VisionFive ÁöÑÊîØÊåÅ ÊúÄËøë Ubuntu ÂºÄÂèë‰∫∫Âëò‰∏ÄÁõ¥Âú®Âä™ÂäõÊèêÈ´òÂíåÊîπÂñÑÂØπËµõÊòâÁßëÊäÄÁöÑ VisionFive ÂçïÊùøÊú∫ÁöÑÊîØÊåÅÔºåÊúâÊúõÂú® Ubuntu 22.10 ‰∏≠ÁúãÂà∞ÂØπËøôÁßç‰Ωé‰∫é 180 ÁæéÂÖÉÁöÑ RISC-V ËÆ°ÁÆóÊú∫ÁöÑËâØÂ•ΩÊîØÊåÅ„ÄÇVisionFive ÊòØ‰∏∫Êï∞‰∏çÂ§öÁöÑ‰∏çË∂ÖËøá 200 ÁæéÂÖÉÁöÑ„ÄÅËÉΩËøêË°åÂÆåÊï¥ Linux ÂèëË°åÁâàÁöÑ RISC-V ‰∏ªÊùø‰πã‰∏Ä„ÄÇËá™ Linux 5.17 ÂÜÖÊ†∏ÂºÄÂßãÔºåÂ∞±ÂØπ VisionFive v1 ÊùøÊèê‰æõ‰∫Ü‰∏ªÁ∫øÊîØÊåÅ„ÄÇ Ê∂àÊÅØÊù•Ê∫êÔºöPhoronix ËÄÅÁéãÁÇπËØÑÔºöÁõÆÂâçËøô‰∏™ÊùøÂ≠êËøòÊòØÊØîËæÉÁº∫Ë¥ßÁöÑÔºåÂ∏åÊúõËÉΩÂú® Ubuntu Á≠âÂèëË°åÁâàÊèê‰æõÊõ¥Â•ΩÁöÑÊîØÊåÅÊó∂ËÉΩËß£ÂÜ≥‰æõË¥ßÈóÆÈ¢ò„ÄÇÊúâÂØπÂú®Ëøô‰∏™ÊùøÂ≠ê‰∏äËøêË°å Ubuntu ÊÑüÂÖ¥Ë∂£ÁöÑÂêåÂ≠¶ÂêóÔºü Êé®ÁâπËÅîÂêàÂàõÂßã‰∫∫ÂÆ£Â∏É Web3 ÁöÑÁ´û‰∫âÂØπÊâãÔºöWeb5 Êé®ÁâπËÅîÂêàÂàõÂßã‰∫∫ Jack Dorsey ËÆ§‰∏∫ Web3 ÂèòÂæóÂíå‰πãÂâçÁöÑ Web2 ‰∏ÄÊ†∑ÊúâÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÂØπÊú™Êù•ÊäóÂÆ°Êü•„ÄÅÊ≥®ÈáçÈöêÁßÅÁöÑ‰∫íËÅîÁΩëÊù•ËØ¥ËøòÂè™ÊòØ‰∏™Ê¢¶ÊÉ≥„ÄÇÁé∞Âú®Ôºå‰ªñÊóó‰∏ãÁöÑÂå∫ÂùóÈìæÂÖ¨Âè∏ TBD ÂàõÈÄ†‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™Êñ∞ÂêçËØç Web5ÔºåÂ∞ÜÈÄöËøáÊîæÂºÉ‰ª•Âå∫ÂùóÈìæ‰∏∫‰∏≠ÂøÉÁöÑÊñπÊ≥ïÊù•ÂÆûÁé∞Êó†ÂÆ°Êü•„ÄÅ‰ª•Ë∫´‰ªΩ‰∏∫‰∏≠ÂøÉÁöÑÁΩëÁªú‰ΩìÈ™åÔºå‰ªéËÄåÂáªË¥•Áé∞ÊúâÁöÑÊ®°Âºè„ÄÇ‰ªñ‰ª¨ÊâÄÂÆ£Áß∞ÁöÑÊäÄÊúØÂèØËÉΩÂíå BT„ÄÅTor Á±ª‰ºº„ÄÇÁõÆÂâçËøô‰∏™ÊâÄË∞ìÁöÑ Web5 ‰ªçÂ§Ñ‰∫éÂºÄÊ∫êÂºÄÂèëÈò∂ÊÆµÔºåÊ≤°ÊúâÊ≠£ÂºèÂèëÂ∏ÉÊó•Êúü„ÄÇ Ê∂àÊÅØÊù•Ê∫êÔºöCoindesk ËÄÅÁéãÁÇπËØÑÔºöÁîüÈÄ†ÂêçËØçÁöÑÊäÄÊúØ‚ÄúÂàõÊñ∞‚ÄùÔºåÂπ∂Ê≤°Êúâ‰ªÄ‰πàÊÑè‰πâÔºåÂ∞±ÂÉèÂçÅÂ§öÂπ¥Ââç Web2 ÂàöÂàöÂàùÈú≤Â§¥ËßíÊó∂Â∞±Êúâ‰∫∫ÂÆ£Áß∞ Web3Ôºå‰ΩÜÊòØÂà∞Áé∞Âú®Ëøû Web3 ‰πüÂπ∂Ê≤°ÊúâÁúüÊ≠£ÂæóÂà∞ÂÖ±ËØÜÂíåËÆ§ÂèØ„ÄÇÊõ¥Âà´ËØ¥ÊâÄË∞ìÁöÑ Web5ÔºåÊàëÂ∞±ÊÉ≥Áü•ÈÅìÔºåWeb4 ÊÄé‰πà‰∫ÜÔºåÊòØ 4 ‰∏çÂêâÂà©‰πà„ÄÇÊ≠§Â§ñÔºåÂÖ∂ËßÜ‰∏∫ÂÖ∏ËåÉÁöÑÔºåÊó†ËÆ∫ÊòØ BT ËøòÊòØ TorÔºåÈÉΩÂ§™Ëøá‰∫éÊøÄËøõ‰∫Ü„ÄÇ
    Â¶Ç‰ΩïÂú® RHEL 9 ‰∏äÂàõÂª∫Êú¨Âú∞ Yum/DNF ‰ªìÂ∫ì
    ‰Ω†Â•ΩÔºåÊäÄÊúØÂÖÑÂºüÔºåÊúÄËøëÁ∫¢Â∏ΩÂèëÂ∏É‰∫ÜÊúÄÊñ∞ÁöÑÊìç‰ΩúÁ≥ªÁªü RHEL 9ÔºåRHEL 9 Êª°Ë∂≥‰∫ÜÊ∑∑Âêà‰∫ëÁöÑÊâÄÊúâË¶ÅÊ±Ç„ÄÇÂÆÉÂèØ‰ª•ÂÆâË£ÖÂú®Áâ©ÁêÜÊúçÂä°Âô®„ÄÅËôöÊãüÊú∫ÂíåÂÆπÂô®ÈïúÂÉè‰∏≠„ÄÇ ÂΩìÊàë‰ª¨Ê≤°ÊúâËÆ¢ÈòÖÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÔºåÊÉ≥ÂÆâË£ÖËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÊù•ÂÅöÂÆûÈ™åÔºåÈÇ£‰πàËÆæÁΩÆÊú¨Âú∞ÁöÑ Yum Êàñ DNF ‰ªìÂ∫ìÂ∞ÜÊòØÂæàÊñπ‰æøÁöÑ„ÄÇ Âú®Êú¨ÊåáÂçó‰∏≠ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Â∞Ü‰ªãÁªçÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÂú® RHEL 9 ‰∏ä‰ΩøÁî® DVD Êàñ ISO Êñá‰ª∂‰∏ÄÊ≠•‰∏ÄÊ≠•Âú∞ÂàõÂª∫Êú¨Âú∞ Yum/DNF ËµÑÊ∫êÂ∫ì„ÄÇ ÂàõÂª∫Êú¨Âú∞ Yum/DNF ËµÑÊ∫êÂ∫ìÁöÑÂÖàÂÜ≥Êù°‰ª∂: ÊúÄÂ∞èÂåñÂÆâË£Ö RHEL 9 Á≥ªÁªü ÂÖ∑ÊúâÁÆ°ÁêÜÊùÉÈôêÁöÑ sudo Áî®Êà∑ RHEL 9 DVD Êàñ ISO Êñá‰ª∂ 1ÔºâÊåÇËΩΩ RHEL 9 ISO Êñá‰ª∂Êàñ DVD Êàë‰ª¨ÂÅáËÆæ RHEL 9 iso Êñá‰ª∂Â∑≤ÁªèË¢´Â§çÂà∂Âà∞Á≥ªÁªü‰∏≠„ÄÇËøêË°å‰∏ãÈù¢ÁöÑÊåÇËΩΩÂëΩ‰ª§ÔºåÂ∞Ü ISO Êñá‰ª∂ÊåÇËΩΩÂà∞¬†/opt/repo¬†Êñá‰ª∂Â§π„ÄÇ $ sudo mkdir /var/repo $ sudo mount -o loop rhel-baseos-9.0-x86_64-dvd.iso /var/repo/ Â¶ÇÊûúÊòØ DVD ÂÖâÁõòÔºåËøêË°åÔºö $ sudo mount /dev/sr0 /var/repo/ 2ÔºâÂú® /etc/yum.repos.d/ ÁõÆÂΩï‰∏≠ÂàõÂª∫‰ªìÂ∫ìÊñá‰ª∂ Âú®¬†/etc/yum.repos.d/¬†ÁõÆÂΩï‰∏ãÂàõÂª∫‰∏Ä‰∏™Âêç‰∏∫ ‚Äúrhel9-local.repo` ÁöÑ‰ªìÂ∫ìÊñá‰ª∂ÔºåÂÜÖÂÆπÂ¶Ç‰∏ãÔºö $ sudo vi /etc/yum.repos.d/rhel9-local.repo [Local-BaseOS] name=Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 - BaseOS metadata_expire=-1 gpgcheck=1 enabled=1 baseurl=file:///var/repo//BaseOS/ gpgkey=file:///etc/pki/rpm-gpg/RPM-GPG-KEY-redhat-release [Local-AppStream] name=Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 - AppStream metadata_expire=-1 gpgcheck=1 enabled=1 baseurl=file:///var/repo//AppStream/ gpgkey=file:///etc/pki/rpm-gpg/RPM-GPG-KEY-redhat-release ‰øùÂ≠òÂπ∂ÂÖ≥Èó≠ËØ•Êñá‰ª∂„ÄÇ 3ÔºâÂà∑Êñ∞ Yum/DNF ÂíåËÆ¢ÈòÖÁÆ°ÁêÜÂô®ÁöÑÁºìÂ≠ò ÊâßË°å‰ª•‰∏ãÂëΩ‰ª§Êù•Ê∏ÖÁêÜ Yum Êàñ DNF ÂíåËÆ¢ÈòÖÁÆ°ÁêÜÂô®ÁöÑÁºìÂ≠ò„ÄÇ $ sudo dnf clean all $ sudo subscription-manager clean Âú®‰∏äÈù¢ÁöÑËæìÂá∫‰∏≠ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÂæóÂà∞‰∏Ä‰∏™Ë≠¶Âëä‰ø°ÊÅØ¬†This system is not registered with an entitlementÔºàÁ≥ªÁªüÊ≤°ÊúâÊ≥®ÂÜåÊùÉÈôêÔºâ„ÄÇÊâÄ‰ª•Ôºå‰∏∫‰∫ÜÊäëÂà∂Ëøô‰∏™Ë≠¶Âëä‰ø°ÊÅØÔºåÁºñËæëÊñá‰ª∂¬†/etc/yum/pluginconf.d/subscription-manager.confÔºåÂ∞ÜÂèÇÊï∞¬†enabled=1¬†Êîπ‰∏∫¬†enabled=0„ÄÇ $ sudo vi /etc/yum/pluginconf.d/subscription-manager.conf ‰øùÂ≠òÂπ∂ÈÄÄÂá∫ËØ•Êñá‰ª∂„ÄÇ 4Ôºâ‰ΩøÁî®Êú¨Âú∞‰ªìÂ∫ìÂÆâË£ÖËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖ Áé∞Âú®Êàë‰ª¨ÈÉΩÂáÜÂ§áÂ•ΩÊµãËØïÊàë‰ª¨ÁöÑÊú¨Âú∞‰ªìÂ∫ì‰∫Ü„ÄÇËøêË°å‰∏ãÈù¢ÁöÑÂëΩ‰ª§Êù•Êü•ÁúãÈÖçÁΩÆ‰ªìÂ∫ì„ÄÇ $ sudo dnf repolist ËæìÂá∫Ôºö Áé∞Âú®ÔºåËØïËØïÁî®¬†dnf¬†ÂëΩ‰ª§ÈÄöËøá‰∏äÈù¢ÈÖçÁΩÆÁöÑÊú¨Âú∞‰ªìÂ∫ìÂÆâË£ÖËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖ„ÄÇ $ sudo dnf install nfs-utils ËæìÂá∫Ôºö ÂÆåÁæéÔºå‰∏äËø∞ËæìÂá∫ËØÅÂÆû‰∫Ü¬†nfs-utils¬†ÂåÖÂèäÂÖ∂‰æùËµñÈ°πÂ∑≤ÁªèÈÄöËøáÊú¨Âú∞ÈÖçÁΩÆÁöÑ Yum Êàñ DNF ‰ªìÂ∫ìÊàêÂäüÂÆâË£Ö„ÄÇ ËøôÂ∞±ÊòØÊú¨ÊåáÂçóÁöÑÂÖ®ÈÉ®ÂÜÖÂÆπ„ÄÇÊàëÂ∏åÊúõ‰Ω†ËßâÂæóÂÆÉÊúâÂèÇËÄÉ‰ª∑ÂÄº„ÄÇËØ∑Âú®‰∏ãÈù¢ÁöÑËØÑËÆ∫Âå∫ÂèëË°®‰Ω†ÁöÑÁñëÈóÆÂíåÂèçÈ¶à„ÄÇ via:¬†https://www.linuxtechi.com/create-local-yum-dnf-repository-rhel/ ‰ΩúËÄÖÔºöPradeep Kumar¬†ÈÄâÈ¢òÔºölkxed¬†ËØëËÄÖÔºögeekpi¬†Ê†°ÂØπÔºöwxy Êú¨ÊñáÁî±¬†LCTT¬†ÂéüÂàõÁºñËØëÔºåLinux‰∏≠ÂõΩ¬†Ëç£Ë™âÊé®Âá∫  ( 1 min )
    ÈöêËóèÂäüËÉΩÔºÅÂú® DuckDuckGo ÊêúÁ¥¢ÂºïÊìé‰∏≠Ôºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•ÂÅöËøô 25 ‰ª∂ÊúâË∂£ÁöÑ‰∫ãÊÉÖ
    ÊØîËµ∑Êó†Â§Ñ‰∏çÂú®ÁöÑ GoogleÔºåÊúâ‰∫õÊêúÁ¥¢ÂºïÊìéÊõø‰ª£ÂìÅÊõ¥Âä†Â∞äÈáçÈöêÁßÅÔºåËÄå DuckDuckGo Â∞±ÊòØÂÖ∂‰∏≠‰πã‰∏Ä„ÄÇ ÊúÄËøëÔºåËøô‰∏™ÊêúÁ¥¢ÂºïÊìéÊúâ‰∫ÜÂæàÂ§ßÁöÑÊîπËøõÔºåÊêúÁ¥¢‰∏ÄËà¨ÁΩëÈ°µÂçÅÂàÜÈ°∫ÁïÖ„ÄÇÂú®ÊêúÁ¥¢Êú¨Âú∞Âú∞ÁÇπÊñπÈù¢ÔºåÂàôËøòËøú‰∏çÂèä Google„ÄÇ ‰∏çËøáÔºåDuckDuckGoÔºàÁÆÄÁß∞‰∏∫ DDGÔºâÊúâ‰∏Ä‰∫õÂæàÈÖ∑ÁöÑÂäüËÉΩÔºåÂ§ßÈÉ®ÂàÜÁî®Êà∑ËøòÊ≤°Ê≥®ÊÑèÂà∞„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰Ωç DDG ÁãÇÁÉ≠Á≤âÔºå‰Ω†ÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÂñúÊ¨¢Áî®Ëøô‰∫õÂ∞èÊäÄÂ∑ßÊù•ÊèêÂçá‰Ω†ÁöÑÊêúÁ¥¢‰ΩìÈ™å„ÄÇ 1„ÄÅË∑≥ËΩ¨Âà∞ÁâπÂÆöÁΩëÈ°µ Âú®‰Ω†ÊúÄÂñúÊ¨¢ÁöÑÁΩëÁ´ôÂêçÁß∞ÂâçËæìÂÖ•¬†!¬†Âç≥ÂèØÁõ¥Êé•ËøõÂÖ•Ëøô‰∏™ÁΩëÁ´ô„ÄÇÂàôÁ±ª‰ºº‰∫é Google ÁöÑ ‚ÄúËøêÊ∞î‰∏çÈîô‚Äù ÂäüËÉΩÔºå‰ΩÜÁî® DDG ÁöÑËØùÊù•ËØ¥ÔºåËøôÂ∞±Âè´ ‚ÄúÂèπÂè∑ÊêúÁ¥¢‚Äù„ÄÇ Êúâ‰∏Ä‰∫õÁΩëÁ´ôÊúâÁº©ÂÜôÂΩ¢ÂºèÔºåÂºÄÂßãËæìÂÖ•Êó∂‰æø‰ºöÊèêÁ§∫„ÄÇ Âú®ÁΩëÁ´ôÂêçÂêéÈù¢ËæìÂÖ•ÊêúÁ¥¢ËØçÔºåÂ∞±ÂèØ‰ª•Áõ¥Êé•ÊäµËææÈÇ£‰∏™ÁΩëÁ´ôÁöÑÊêúÁ¥¢ÁªìÊûúÂ§Ñ„ÄÇ 2„ÄÅÊñáÊú¨ËΩ¨ ASCII Figlet ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™¬†ÊúâË∂£ÁöÑ Linux ÂëΩ‰ª§ÔºåÂèØ‰ª•Â∞Ü‰ªªÊÑèÊñáÊú¨ËΩ¨Êç¢‰∏∫ÊºÇ‰∫ÆÁöÑ ASCII ÁîªÊ†ºÂºè„ÄÇ Âú®‰ªªÊÑèÊêúÁ¥¢ËØçÂâçËæìÂÖ•¬†figletÔºåÂ∞±‰ºöÊòæÁ§∫ ASCII ËæìÂá∫„ÄÇÊó†ÈúÄÊâìÂºÄÁªàÁ´Ø„ÄÇ 3„ÄÅÊ£ÄÊü•Á§æ‰∫§Â™í‰ΩìÁöÑÁä∂ÊÄÅ Âú®Êüê‰∏™‰∫∫ÁöÑ Twitter ÂêçÂâçÂä†‰∏ä¬†@ÔºåÂ∞±‰ºöÊòæÁ§∫ TA ÁöÑÁä∂ÊÄÅÔºàÂÖ≥Ê≥®ËÄÖÁ≠âÔºâ„ÄÇ 4„ÄÅÁîüÊàêÂº∫ÂØÜÁ†Å ËæìÂÖ•¬†password¬†Âπ∂Âä†‰∏äÈúÄË¶ÅÁöÑÂ≠óÁ¨¶Êï∞ÔºåÂ∞±ÂèØ‰ª•ÁîüÊàê‰∏Ä‰∏™Áã¨ÁâπÁöÑÂº∫ÂØÜÁ†Å„ÄÇ 5„ÄÅÁîüÊàêÈöèÊú∫ÂØÜÁ†ÅÁü≠ËØ≠ ËæìÂÖ•¬†random passphrase¬†ÂèØÁîüÊàê‰∏ÄÊÆµÂØÜÁ†ÅÁü≠ËØ≠ÔºåÈÄöÂ∏∏ÈïøÂ∫¶‰∏∫ 4 ‰∏™ËØç„ÄÇ 6„ÄÅËé∑Âèñ‰∏Ä‰ªΩÈÄüÊü•Ë°® Âú®ÈúÄË¶ÅÁúãÈÄüÊü•Ë°®ÁöÑÊêúÁ¥¢ËØçÂêéÈù¢ÔºåÂèØËæìÂÖ•¬†cheatsheet„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûúË¶ÅÊêúÁ¥¢ÁöÑ‰∏úË•øÊúâÈÄüÊü•Ë°®ÔºåÂ∞±‰ºöÁ´ãÂç≥ÊòæÁ§∫Âú®ÊêúÁ¥¢È°µÈù¢„ÄÇ 7„ÄÅÈÄöËøáËâ≤Á†ÅËé∑ÂèñÈ¢úËâ≤ ËæìÂÖ•¬†color¬†Âπ∂Âä†‰∏ä‰Ω†ÊÉ≥Êü•ÁöÑÈ¢úËâ≤ÁöÑÂçÅÂÖ≠ËøõÂà∂Á†ÅÔºå‰æøÂèØÊòæÁ§∫Ëøô‰∏™È¢úËâ≤„ÄÇ 8„ÄÅÁîüÊàêÈöèÊú∫Êï∞ ÊêúÁ¥¢¬†random number¬†‰ºöËæìÂá∫‰∏Ä‰∏™ 0 Âà∞ 1 ‰πãÈó¥ÁöÑÈöèÊú∫Êï∞„ÄÇ ‰Ω†‰πüÂèØ‚Ä¶  ( 1 min )
    openSUSE Leap 15.4 ÂèëÂ∏ÉÁâàÊú¨Ê∑ªÂä†‰∫Ü Leap Micro 5.2„ÄÅÊõ¥Êñ∞Ê°åÈù¢ÁéØÂ¢ÉÁ≠âÁ≠â
    ‰∏∫Â•ãËµ∑Áõ¥ËøΩ SUSE Linux Enterprise ÁöÑ SP 4 ÔºåopenSUSE Leap 15.4 Âà∞Êù•‰∫ÜÔºåÂ∏¶Êù•‰∫ÜÊñ∞ÁöÑÂçáÁ∫ßÂíåÊûÅÂÖ∂ÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑÊîπÂñÑ„ÄÇ Âç≥Â∞ÜÂà∞Êù•ÁöÑ openSUSE As a bonus, I will provide a list of thumb rules which you should follow while making any style changes.     10 Secure Coding Best Practices to Follow in Every Project
    Let's see how we can make more secure software. Using vulnerable and outdated components with known vulnerabilities has always been in the OWASP Top 10 Application Security Risks. You can take a giant leap in securing your projects only if you use up-to-date tools and libraries. If you have the Not invented here (NIH) syndrome, you prefer to develop everything from scratch. That's fine if you have the time and money to do so. But building major things like cryptography and web servers from scratch needs a lot of skills and effort. Such complex components cannot be built by a single person. Even if you have made one, you should not use it in production without in-depth reviews from many other people. In design and architecture concepts, you should do the same. You should follow best practic‚Ä¶  ( 4 min )
    Argo CD and Sealed Secrets is a perfect match
    TL;DR Sealed Secrets can works perfectly well with Argo CD. It is one of the very best secret managment approachs that you should consider. The same idea can apply to both Helm, Kustomize or other GitOps tools. There is no golden standard about secret management in Argo CD. Instead, Argo CD just provides you a list of solutions here and you have to think it yourself. Although I opt-in for Sealed Secrets, I also want to show you why you should use it instead of just telling you to use it. To answer why, we need to think about two questions. Although there are many solutions available, basically there are just two ways to store secrets, i.e. store in secret management platforms or git repositories. I don't prefer to use secret management platforms. No matter what platform you use, it won‚Ä¶  ( 5 min )
